Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description

Tasks:

Following tasks will be performed by external service provider as data ETL process manager:


Perform the data collection activities for the Kohesio Platform relying on data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solution.
Perform data analysis, convert and update different data types/sets (ETL).
Produces data models according to specific problems statements.
Designs and deploys data collection and web scraping algorithms using specialised Python libraries.
Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions etc., ...).
Write the different documentation associated with the tasks.



Job Requirements

Knowledge and skills

Following skills and knowledge are required for the performance of the above listed tasks:


Excellent knowledge of Data Analytics techniques and tools.
Proficient experience with languages like R, Python.
Expertise knowledge of business intelligence tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau).
Expertise in the ETL processes and tools.
Knowledge of SQL tools
Experience in Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing – nice to have.
Ability to work in a team as well as autonomously.
Results-oriented mindset, focused on delivering.
Good communication skills in English, both orally and in written form.



Specific Expertise:

Following specific expertise is mandatory for the performance of tasks:


Minimum 3 years of professional experience in Data Science. Excellent command of Python and proficiency with relevant libraries, including but not limited to NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn.
Track records in cleaning and transforming raw data into a usable format for analysis.
Minimum 2 years of professional ETL tools (e.g. Apache Airflow, dbt)
Track record of implemented solutions that solved business problems and produced tangible results
Minimum 2 year with cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). Experience with Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is an asset.
Minimum 2 years of experience with version control system (Git Hub)
Excellent command of English

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
CluePoints is a fast-growing company and the premier provider of Risk-Based Quality Management and Data Quality Oversight solutions to clinical research organizations. Our products utilize advanced statistical and machine learning algorithms to assess the quality of clinical trial data both during and following study execution. At CluePoints, we are looking for people with fresh ideas to keep developing our algorithms and help us to sustain our growth.

Responsibilities

As a member of our Research team:


You develop new machine learning models to enhance the CluePoints web platform and/or to develop new products.
You identify promising ML techniques from scientific literature and assess their viability
You leverage relevant open-source resources and keep yourself up-to-date to new developments in this area
You produce robust and clean python code
You follow ML best practices to keep track of experiments and models
You identify new fields of applications for machine learning and deep learning within CluePoints and contribute to increased adoption of machine learning within the healthcare industry
You stay on the edge of relevant research and help CluePoints to continue increasing its scientific visibility by participating at scientific conferences and publishing in scientific journals


Main Qualifications


Master or PhD in Computer sciences or quantitative fields (maths, physics, ...)
Professional experience in machine learning / data science
Efficient in Python
Good knowledge in at least one deep learning platform like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Experience with code versioning tools such as Git


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with deep learning and natural language Processing
Experience in supporting deployments of machine learning models
Experience with medical data
Experience in GPU computing


Top reasons to work with us:


Flexibility is part of our DNA and you’ll find at CluePoints you can work 100% from home or choose to come to the office any day (please note that this point only concerns employees located in our office in Belgium).
If you choose to come to the office, you’ll discover a fun atmosphere including a game room (e.g., withkicker, PS4, arcade machine, nerf battles, and our newly added dartboard).
Many activities are organized during the year, such as soccer, team lunches, happy hours, LAN parties, board games nights! We also have running groups, languages lessons, and much more!
You’ll be working within a squad organization offering you ownership on projects, and utilize high quality equipment like powerful laptops and screens.
At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: you’ll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities.
You’ll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment.
You’ll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards!
Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits, company car, bonus potential, employee referral program.

Title: Machine Learning Software Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Software Engineer




Distributed ML Training




Location: Fully Remote

Type: Full-time




Join an innovative Series A Deep Tech company at the forefront of AI and blockchain technology! Backed by top investors with over $50 million in funding, our client is a team of 20 industry experts, looking to grow to 35. They are leveraging blockchain to provide globally accessible computing resources for AI platforms and are seeking world-class engineers to accelerate AI progress. This is a fully remote role offering a high level of autonomy.




Responsibilities:




ML Orchestration System Design: Develop systems for orchestrating ML execution across decentralized and heterogeneous infrastructure.
Performance Optimization: Profile and optimize training algorithms continually.
Implement Novel Research: Build new mechanisms and algorithms to solve unprecedented problems.
Engineering Support: Collaborate on broader ML issues, such as reproducible training.
Technical Writing and Engagement: Contribute to technical reports and papers, and engage with the community.




Minimum Requirements:




Distributed Foundation Model Training: Experience designing or working with training systems on large clusters.
Networking Proficiency: Understanding and troubleshooting experience with IP, TCP, UDP, HTTP, and communication backends like NCCL, GLOO, and MPI.
Open Source Contributions: Experience with large open-source codebases as a maintainer or trusted contributor.
Rust Enthusiasm: Willingness to learn Rust to work across the codebase.
Computer Science Background: Solid understanding of computational complexity and broad knowledge of algorithms and data structures.
Self-motivation and Communication: Highly self-motivated with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Applied Research Comfort: Comfortable working in a high-autonomy, unpredictable applied research environment.




Bonus Skills:




Rust Expertise: Strong experience with systems programming in Rust, understanding lifetimes, and the purpose of Pin.
Research Experience: Published research in distributed systems or ML domains.
Blockchain Knowledge: Understanding of blockchain fundamentals.







Be part of a team dedicated to democratizing AI, where you can leverage your expertise in distributed ML training, networking, and open-source contributions to make a significant impact. Embrace autonomy, continuous learning, and the drive to push innovative solutions in a highly collaborative and flexible environment.




Apply now to join this cutting-edge team and contribute to the future of AI!

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to shape the future of AI? Clario are looking for a visionary AI Engineer to propel our innovative journey forward in the clinical trials and pharmaceutical industries. Dive into the heart of AI research and development, where your expertise in machine learning, deep learning, and software engineering will fuel transformative solutions that redefine business success and directly impact the lives of patients globally.




What we offer

Competitive compensation
Attractive benefits (security, flexibility, support and well-being)
Remote or hybrid working
Full technology setup and support




What you'll be doing

The AI Engineer will play a key role in researching, designing, developing, and implementing AI-based solutions that drive business objectives and contribute to the advancement of our AI capabilities. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in machine learning, deep learning, and software engineering, along with a passion for tackling challenging problems using AI techniques.

Research, design, and implement ML/Deep Learning models applied to natural language processing, data classification, and other areas.
Design and implement solutions leveraging state of the art GenAI models, including Large Language models.
Participate in the fine-tuning of LLMs, including the preparation of data sets.
Perform required accuracy measures and model validations.
Collaborate with product managers, domain experts, and medical scientists to define requirements.
Partner with software engineers for seamless integration of AI models, ensuring operational success.
Engage with scientific literature to stay ahead of emerging trends.
Drive automation and efficiency improvements in our workflows.
Provide support to internal teams, facilitating resolution of technical issues.
Identify and pursue new opportunities to add value to the organization and departmental processes.
Foster a collaborative environment, supporting colleagues in achieving collective and individual goals.




What we look for

Degree in Computer Science, Biomedical Engineering, Physics, or a related field
3+ Years of experience Developing natural language processing models/applications with a proficiency in programming languages such as Python or C++
Performing model training across different model architectures and data modalities
Strong understanding of various Deep Learning techniques.
Past experience developing AI models for the healthcare and life science industry a plus.
Solid understanding of machine learning tools and techniques (e.g., Pytorch, Keras, TensorFlow, Pandas, Scikit-learn).
Familiarity with software and systems engineering concepts, including cloud computing, continuous integration, and continuous deployment (CI/CD) is a plus.
Exceptional motivational and team-building skills, fostering a collaborative and inclusive team environment. Ability to work in group setting and independently.
Ability to organize and prioritize assigned tasks to meet established schedules, timelines, or deadlines.
Problem solving abilities.
Excellent attention to detail and meticulous work.




At Clario, we put people first, always. We are united and driven by patients, committed to making a difference, and we are always looking for the best talent to help us transform lives. We value the contribution each of our people brings. It’s only through our people that we can continue to innovate technology that will shape the future of clinical trials.




Clario is committed to providing an inclusive workplace that welcomes diversity and equal opportunity. We encourage all qualified candidates who are passionate about sustainability, ethical business, and making a positive impact to apply for this role.

Title: Applied Machine Learning Research Engineer
Description:
Senior Applied Machine Learning Researcher - Distributed Model Training

Remote




We're hiring for a Machine Learning Researcher for a Series A start-up (over 50 million in funding and backed by top investors). The team are pushing the boundaries of machine learning research in a decentralized and heterogeneous environment. The mission is to train highly distributed models over uniquely decentralized infrastructure, revolutionizing the way neural networks are built and deployed.




Responsibilities:




Train models on decentralized and heterogeneous infrastructure, focusing on high-volume model training.
Serve as a bridge between researchers generating novel ideas and production engineers implementing them.
Manage and maintain experimental frameworks and test benches for ML research.
Provide engineering support, addressing reproducibility and other ML-related issues.
Follow best practices in design, testing, and documentation of code.
Publish research papers for top-tier AI conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, AAAI, IJCAI) and collaborate with academic and research institutions.




Minimum Requirements:




Strong background in applied machine learning with hands-on experience in training models.
Proficient in building and managing distributed systems.
Strong coding skills with a focus on running experiments rather than developing novel concepts.
Comfortable working in a high-autonomy, unpredictable research environment.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.




Preferred Qualifications:




Experience with highly distributed model training.




Please apply for more details, we're looking forward to hearing from you

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
What can you expect?

Python Predictions is currently looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer. In this role, you will need to be able to adapt quickly to new technologies, applications and environments. You will operate with our current clients on a medium to long-term basis.

As an ML Engineer, you will help our clients building and serving machine learning models. More specifically, the responsibilities include:

Design and implement solutions to serve machine learning models, from traditional ML to Generative AI.
Train, improve, and deploy ML models.
Write production ready code and serve online, batch, and real time models
Identify, design, and implement process improvements in the machine learning lifecylce: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-design infrastructure for greater scalability, etc
Collaborate with Data Scientists, MLOps Engineers and Data Engineers, to integrate all parts of the solution.
Coach colleagues and clients in your area of expertise







Who are we looking for?

Required

Master or PhD in Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Engineering, or related field.
At least 3 years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist, MLOps Engineer, or in a similar position.
Strong software engineering background
Experience deploying machine learning in production
Experience with experiment tracking, models monitoring, and deployment strategies
Ability to write production ready code in Python.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and understanding of Infrastructure as Code
Knowledge of containers and container orchestration.
Master software engineering best practices and software release cycle.
Solid understanding of Linux and in depth knowledge of at least one cloud provider.
Knowledge of big data technologies such as Apache Spark, Kafka.
Able to coach others and give technical advice and direction.Experience building, scheduling and maintaining ML pipelines
Able to work independently, prioritize multiple stakeholders and tasks, and manage work time effectively
Proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus







What do we have to offer?

Python Predictions is a Brussels-based service provider specialized in data projects with business impact
In January 2020, Python Predictions joined Tobania – a leading Belgian business & technology consulting. And in turn, in March 2023, Tobania joined Sopra Steria – a major Tech player in Europe recognized for its consulting, digital services and software development
Great variation in job content due to missions in different industries, different domains and different environments
In-company training adapted to your personal needs
Continuous learning in monthly team meetings and personal development time
A great team of colleagues with shared values

Discover our Tobania galaxy

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
🤖 The Job

Dataroots researches, designs and codes robust AI-solutions & platforms for various sectors, with a strong focus on DataOps and MLOps. As Machine Learning Engineer you are part of our dedicated in-house team of AI-specialists. You excel in building machine learning models which result in our robust and production-ready solutions to optimise company processes.

You love data and turning data inside out to reveal all its secrets. You are an expert in developing and implementing various statistical and machine learning models and you are in charge of controlling the performances of your models output. You love to experiment with different approaches to ensure your client the best-in-class solution. To achieve this, you collaborate closely with our data engineers and/or cloud architects on projects for various sectors, always with a quality focused, end-to-end approach. The result? Our teams provide clients a reliable foundation to make data-driven decisions.

As a senior, you will also build and share knowledge with your colleagues. Through a multitude of initiatives, you have various chances to share your knowledge and keep up to date with the latest developments in the field.




🎉 What you can expect at Dataroots

Dataroots was founded in 2016 and, since its beginnings, has focused on helping its customers achieve excellence in their data-driven operations. The only way to do this sustainably is by investing in team well-being, diversity, knowledge sharing and customer experience. This quality-first focus has allowed sustained and healthy growth over the years. Join a team where you can have an impact on our growth story. Read up more on our DNA over at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].




💪 The Skills

You have a knack for Machine Learning and have attained a Masters or Doctorate in a quantitative field.
You have a strong background and are opinionated on software design principles.
You have at least 2 years experience in a field related to machine learning and big data.
You have a strong theoretical basis and experience in general machine learning & deep learning.
You are excellent in Python. Experience in SQL is a big plus, knowledge of R or Scala is a bonus.
You have an initial experience in deploying ML models and expertise in MLOps.
You have a basic understanding of cloud engineering.
You get excited by large amounts of data.
You approach problems with a pragmatic mindset.
You have strong communication skills and can translate complex solutions into clear and understandable explanations.
You have a good overview over the (big-)data ecosystem.
You speak English and Dutch fluently.




Was this list a bit much? Don't worry, we don't expect you to tick every box from the beginning. Most of all we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us.




💰 The Offer

* An attractive salary package with extralegal benefits such as a company car & fuel card or mobility budget, hospitalisation insurance, group insurance, and a high-end laptop and a smartphone.

* A personal & team training budget to further your professional career.

* Your innovation budget to work on cool, educational, challenging and open-source projects within your guild.

* (Virtual) Team Buildings, team gatherings to let off steam and be part of our sports initiatives.




🇧🇪 Our main offices are in Leuven, Ghent and Utrecht 🇳🇱 , with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These locations are always available for brainstorming sessions or team events. As a Dataroots consultant, much work can be performed remotely, but you will most likely also visit our clients on-site.




Ready for a new chapter as a Machine Learning Engineer at Dataroots? Super! Apply now! 🎉

Python Predictions is currently looking for an experienced NLP Engineer. In this role, you will need to be able to adapt quickly to new technologies, applications and environments. You will operate with our current clients on a medium to long-term basis

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (MLOps)
Description:
Just as every tooth is unique and requires precision in its care, our AI solutions demand precision in their design and implementation. At Promaton, we're revolutionizing dental healthcare with AI, and we need your expertise. See our company page to learn more about what we do.

As a Software Engineer in Machine Learning you will be working closely with our platform and product teams, enabling fast iterations and scalable ML solutions for existing and future products. You will extend our already successful track record of 5 ML products processing thousands of cases weekly for over 1K customers.




As part of our dynamic team, you will be:

Improving and contributing to the design and architecture of a complex set of interdependent ML pipelines.
Following MLOps best practices by maintaining and extending our CI/CD pipelines, dashboards, dev/test/prod environments, autoscaling, etc.
Working with an accomplished team of machine learning researchers and engineers that already have 8 patents on their name.
Helping researchers launch new products and help maintain the ones already used by customers.

Some initiatives on our MLOps roadmap for the next months:

1. Improving speed and robustness of multiple machine learning products

2. Continuous monitoring of incoming data in production

The challenges you’ll face:

All our products process large data points, ranging from 5 up to 700MB. This means that a lot of off-the-shelf tooling doesn't work for us, and we need to invent our own to process and manage our data.
Our teams are growing and so is our code base. This comes with the challenge to keep it well-designed and maintainable.
We are a cloud-native company, and cloud-native ML frameworks are still in their early days. You'll help us navigate the ever-evolving ecosystem of tools, to make sure we find the right balance between off-the-shelf and home-grown tooling.
Medical AI has to comply with the highest quality standards. While in other industries failing to predict for example a recommended product has little consequence, in the medical field you don't want to be wrong.




The perks of working at Promaton:

💰 Attractive salary package, and excellent employment terms

🏡 Excellent work/life balance. Freedom to work from home or anywhere you like (and any time you like). We only have a few touchpoints.

👩‍🔬 Dedicated time for hackathons and growth, to explore new ideas of your own. Every quarter we have a hackathon week where you can work on anything you like to expand your skill set!

🙌 Staying up to date with the latest happenings in the ML field can be hard. That is why we organize monthly paper review sessions to discuss the latest developments in the field to stay up to date with the current state-of-the-art. Next to that we regularly hold “ML Sparring Sessions” where you can spar with other MLRs in the company on potential directions for projects you are working on.

🎓 Real training budget for books and conferences or anything else you need to grow

🚀 Work with the latest technology, at the forefront of a rapidly developing field in medical imaging AI. Checkout our techstack here.

💪 Loads of responsibility and autonomy (we hate micromanagement) and a chance to make a real impact

🏖 Awesome yearly company retreat, and quarterly team events

⛺️ 32 days of annual leave

💻 Top-notch gear, and even bigger servers to play with

🏄‍♂️ Promaton is funded for many years to come, meaning you can have the impact you only get at a startup, but with the job security of an established company

🛬 For international engineers, based in the NL (already relocated to the Netherlands) we are able to offer visa sponsorship

🎈Inclusive environment, we value and celebrate diversity




Job requirements

4+ years experience working with Python and Pytorch
Solid understanding of software development best practices
A passion for software and ML pipeline design concepts
The git ecosystem is your natural habitat
Know how good tests improve developer velocity
Experience with continuous deployment of live products
Experience with AWS/GCP/Azure or Kubernetes deployment
Good collaboration and communication skills

Bonus points:

Experience with experiment, model and data tracking
Knowledge of machine learning fundamentals
Worked with 3D data, like meshes and point clouds
Experience working asynchronously with a distributed team
Previous experience in medical or other regulated field




We're excited to see how you can make a difference in our team. If you're passionate about making a tangible impact in healthcare through AI, we'd love to hear from you!

Show more

🛬 For international engineers, based in the NL (already relocated to the Netherlands) we are able to offer visa sponsorship

🎈Inclusive environment, we value and celebrate diversity


Job requirements

  • 4+ years experience working with Python and Pytorch
  • Solid understanding of software development best practices
  • A passion for software and ML pipeline design concepts
  • The git ecosystem is your natural habitat
  • Know how good tests improve developer velocity
  • Experience with continuous deployment of live products
  • Experience with AWS/GCP/Azure or Kubernetes deployment
  • Good collaboration and communication skills

Bonus points:

  • Experience with experiment, model and data tracking
  • Knowledge of machine learning fundamentals
  • Worked with 3D data, like meshes and point clouds
  • Experience working asynchronously with a distributed team
  • Previous experience in medical or other regulated field


We're excited to see how you can make a difference in our team. If you're passionate about making a tangible impact in healthcare through AI, we'd love to hear from you!

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Backend Engineer




About Remobi:




We are building the world's greatest community of remote technologists!




Today, organizations that understand the value of remote working will reap the rewards. Because it doesn’t just provide team members with a healthier work-life balance, it gives you the opportunity to access the brightest minds in the world.




Our clients access our community to build or extend their existing teams. All are made up of remote, distributed software engineering experts - the best-in-class. Rapidly deployed without compromising on quality.




Join our Remobi community to have access to meaningful, innovative freelance projects and play a key role in shaping how companies operate.




Duration: Until End of Sept 2024 (Most likely to extend to Sept 2025)

Start: ASAP

Location: Remote (Candidates Must be in Europe)

Position Type: Freelance/Contract/B2B




Summary




As a Python Developer, you will play a crucial role in troubleshooting and optimizing machine learning applications. Your expertise with AWS, CI/CD pipelines, and Git will ensure the reliability and performance of our customer-facing solutions. You will work closely with data scientists to implement and refine machine learning models, ensuring they are seamlessly integrated into our applications.

Develop, test, and maintain Python applications in an AWS environment.
Implement and manage CI/CD pipelines to ensure efficient and reliable code deployment.

Collaborate with data scientists to refine and optimize machine learning models.

Stay current with industry best practices and emerging technologies.

Proven experience as a Python Developer, with a focus on AWS and CI/CD pipelines.
Strong knowledge of Git and version control best practices.
Experience troubleshooting and optimizing machine learning applications.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
Strong communication skills and the ability to interact with customers effectively.
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and frameworks is a plus.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Our goal is to create the most personalized, effective, and inspiring educational journey online and through our sales channels, helping students worldwide achieve personal growth.




Role: Senior Data Scientist

Location: Remote/ Germany

Salary: €100,000




Responsibilities:

Develop and implement predictive models for cutting-edge dynamic recommender systems and content creation, utilizing customer data to enhance personalized sales experiences.
Design and execute analytical algorithms for data-driven insights, such as semantic clustering or attribution methods, to gain a deeper understanding of user personas and customer requirements.
Contribute to the creation of an AI-powered Sales Tech infrastructure, including continuous training and deployment pipelines.




Your Profile:

Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer, specifically with recommender systems and time-series analysis.
Skilled in applying attention-based models to graph-based or sequential data.
Proficient in Python and familiar with the broader data science toolkit.
Proven track record of deploying models to production environments using cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP, with a solid understanding of CI/CD processes, Docker, Kubernetes; experience with Kafka is beneficial.
Strong knowledge of database management, including SQL and NoSQL database systems.

Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Description:
Role: Machine Learning Researcher

Location: Europe (fully remote)

Salary: $150,000 - $200,000 + equity at a rapidly growing AI startup




About Us: We are a dynamic and innovative technology company specializing in financial data automation and analytics. Our mission is to revolutionize the way financial data is processed and analyzed through cutting-edge machine learning and artificial intelligence technologies. Join us and be a part of a team that is transforming the financial industry.




Job Description: As a Machine Learning Researcher with a deep specialization in Deep Learning, you will play a pivotal role in advancing our machine learning capabilities. You will work closely with a talented team of researchers and engineers to develop state-of-the-art deep learning algorithms and models that enhance our data processing and analytical systems. Your work will directly impact the efficiency and accuracy of financial data analysis, contributing to the success of our clients and the growth of our company.




Key Responsibilities:

Conduct cutting-edge research and development in deep learning to solve complex problems in financial data automation and analytics.
Design, implement, and evaluate advanced deep learning models and algorithms.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate deep learning solutions into production systems.
Analyze large and complex datasets to extract meaningful insights and identify patterns.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in deep learning and AI, and apply them to improve existing systems.
Publish research findings in top-tier conferences and journals.
Mentor and guide junior researchers and interns.




Qualifications:

Ph.D. or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field, with a focus on deep learning.
Proven experience in deep learning research, with a strong publication record in top-tier conferences and journals.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java.
Extensive knowledge of deep learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras).
Experience with NLP, time series analysis, and large-scale data processing using deep learning techniques.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex technical concepts to a non-technical audience.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience in the financial services industry or related domains.
Familiarity with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark).




What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Flexible work hours and remote work options.
Opportunity to work on groundbreaking projects and make a significant impact in the financial industry.
Collaborative and innovative work environment.

Join us and leverage your deep learning expertise to drive innovation and excellence in financial data automation and analytics. Apply now to become a part of our forward-thinking team.

Title: Senior AI/ML Engineer
Description:
OLSYS provides full-service solutions for mid-market and enterprise organizations.

With 15+ years of experience, 100+ projects, and 50+ strong technical experts in the team, we continue to grow by expanding our development team in Europe, as well as expanding the base of new clients and projects.

As an enterprise software development company, we are building long-term partnerships helping our clients accelerate their digital experiences with reasonable IT investments.

Our tailored approach, e-commerce focus, and flexible solutions allow us to design, develop, and deliver scalable, integrated commerce platforms that drive profits and boost the business.

Our Industry Focus

— Banking and Finance (business continuity management, planning system, banking app development);

— Retail and E-Commerce (B2B Commerce, B2C Commerce, Digital/E-Commerce customer experience);

— Healthcare (website development for Healthcare organizations).

Our Expertise Includes

— Commerce Solutions

— Development Services

— Creative Services

— Quality Assurance and Testing

— Maintenance and Support

— E-Commerce Consulting

The Role

Responsibilities


Interact with the modern LLMs and adopt the best practices of their usage.
R&D activities (experimenting with LLMs): Generate code based on the input description. Build test cases based on the user scenarios.
Performance Monitoring: Monitor the performance of the models and make adjustments as necessary to maintain or enhance model accuracy and efficiency.
Data Preprocessing and Annotation: Work with the Data Engineering team to preprocess and annotate the training data for AI/ML models. Collaborate with subject matter experts to create labeled datasets that facilitate supervised and unsupervised learning.
Prototyping and Evaluation: Rapidly prototype and iterate different AI/ML approaches to identify the most suitable solution to meet the requirements.


Perform rigorous evaluations to measure the model's performance against defined metrics.


Documentation: Document all stages of the AI/ML development process, including design choices, architecture, algorithms, and evaluation results, ensuring knowledge transfer and team understanding.
Collaboration: Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Data Scientists and Software Engineers.
Stay Abreast of Industry Trends: Keep up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI/ML, NLP, LLM and other relevant technologies. Integrate new research findings and methodologies into the project as applicable.


Ideal Profile


Experience: Demonstrated experience of at least 5 years in developing AI/ML solutions with a focus on LLM and LLM frameworks (e.g. LangChain). Strong knowledge and practical experience in Generative AI, Interactive Chatbots, Graph databases.
Data Processing: Experience in preprocessing and handling large-scale, unstructured text data, and the ability to perform data analysis and validation.
Problem-solving and Innovation: Proven ability to tackle complex technical challenges, think innovatively, and propose creative solutions to real-world problems.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


English level: Upper-Intermediate

What's on Offer?


You can contribute and influence the development of a new product
Work with AI product
Flexible working options

Title: Data & AI Engineer
Description:
As a Data & AI Engineer, you will turn our customers’ ambitions into practical data and AI-driven projects. You are a tech-savvy process enthusiast, skilled in data management, and passionate about tackling intricate challenges. You will dive deep into a project's details to ensure its success.




Location: Main office in Kontich (BE), hubs in Ghent (BE) & Woerden (NL)




What you'll do




Understand the data ecosystem and its role in engineering and machine learning solutions.
Use enterprise knowledge and data to guide our clients toward data-driven decision-making.
Help stakeholders understand data architecture, business intelligence, machine learning, data science, visualisation, and reporting.
Bridge the gap between IT and business and drive organisational change with soft skills.
Drive client growth and transformation through your meaningful contributions.




What you're good at




You know how to work with the Microsoft Azure suite, Databricks, and Microsoft Fabric. Experience with visualisation tools is a big plus.
You know how to work with SQL and/or Python. Experience with writing ETLs and cloud computing is a plus.
You have strong analytical skills, and you love delving into details.
You have experience with business analytics and handling large sets of data.
You have excellent communication skills: you can effortlessly explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
You're intrigued by cutting-edge technologies such as generative AI.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or English. Proficiency in French is a big plus.




This could be you




I love showing our clients a new perspective on their business processes and helping them see how things really work. Add bullet point: make an impact at the client and help them grow/transform.

Title: AI/ML and MLOps Field Engineer
Description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing.

We are hiring an AI/ML and MLOps Field Engineer to help global companies embrace AI in their business, using the latest open source capabilities on public and private cloud infrastructure, Linux and Kubernetes. Our team applies expert insights to real-world customer problems, enabling the enterprise adoption of Ubuntu, Kubeflow, MLFlow, Feast, DVC and related analytics, machine learning and data technologies. We are working to create the world's best open source data platform, covering traditional SQL databases and today's NoSQL data stores, as well as the machinery which turns data into insights and executable models.

The people who love this role are software engineers who enjoy customer conversations and solving customer problems during the presales cycle. They are are developers who like to solve customer problems through architecture, presentations and training. Ubuntu is used by pretty much every enterprise in the world, in every industry. This is a fantastic opportunity to learn about the open source technology landscape and develop your business technology insights. You will see first hand in various industries how Linux - and Ubuntu in particular - is shaping innovation and changing the world for the better.

This role is particularly suited to candidates with a technical background who are business minded and driven by commercial success. This role is on our global Field Engineering team and will work closely with enterprise sales leads. We are specifically looking for people interested in solving the most difficult problems in modern data architectures. Training LLMs on multiple K8s clusters deployed on a hybrid cloud infrastructure with GPU sharing across multiple teams? Processing 10M events in real time for financial transactions? Object detection on 10k parallel 4K video streams? These are the problems we solve day to day.

Location: Most of our colleagues work from home. We are growing teams in EMEA, Americas and APAC time zones, so can accommodate candidates from almost any country.

What your day will look like

The global Field Engineering team members are Linux and cloud solutions architects for our customers, designing private and public cloud solutions fitting their workload needs. They are the cloud consultants who work hands-on with the technologies by deploying, testing and handing over the solution to our support or managed services team at the end of a project. They are also software engineers who use Python to develop Kubernetes operators and Linux open source infrastructure-as-code.


Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications
Architect cloud infrastructure solutions like Kubernetes, Kubeflow, OpenStack, and Spark
Deliver solutions either on-premise or in public cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
Collect customer business requirements and advise them on Ubuntu and relevant open source applications
Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values
Deliver presentations and demonstrations of Ubuntu Pro and AI/ML capabilities to prospective and current clients
Liaise with product teams to give them feedback on requirements to influence roadmap
Work collaboratively with your sales team to reach our common targets
Global travel up to 25% of time for internal and external events and 25% to customer meetings


What we are looking for in you


Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
Experience in data engineering, MLOps, or big data solutions deployment
Experience with a relevant programming language, like Python, R, or Rust.
Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
Demonstrated personal interest in continuous learning and development
Practical knowledge of Linux, virtualisation, containers and networking
Business-minded technology thinker and problem solver
Knowledge of cloud computing concepts & leaders, such as Kubernetes, AWS, Azure, GCP
Interest in large-scale enterprise open source - private clouds, machine learning and AI, data and analytics
Intermediate level Python programming skills
Passion for technology evidenced by personal projects and initiatives
The work ethic and confidence to shine alongside motivated colleagues
Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
A dynamic person who loves to jump in new projects and interact with people
Appreciative of diversity, polite and effective in a multi-cultural, multi-national organisation
Thoughtfulness and self-motivation
Result-oriented, with a personal drive to follow up and meet commitments
Ability to travel internationally, for company events up to two weeks long, and customer or industry meetings


What you'll learn


Architect and deploy AI/ML infrastructures, data processing pipelines and multi-cluster distributed training
Wide range of open source applications and skills
Work directly with customers in a range of different businesses
Real-life and hands-on exposure to a wide range of emerging technologies and tools


What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.


Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.


Show more
HTML:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing.

We are hiring an AI/ML and MLOps Field Engineer to help global companies embrace AI in their business, using the latest open source capabilities on public and private cloud infrastructure, Linux and Kubernetes. Our team applies expert insights to real-world customer problems, enabling the enterprise adoption of Ubuntu, Kubeflow, MLFlow, Feast, DVC and related analytics, machine learning and data technologies. We are working to create the world's best open source data platform, covering traditional SQL databases and today's NoSQL data stores, as well as the machinery which turns data into insights and executable models.

The people who love this role are software engineers who enjoy customer conversations and solving customer problems during the presales cycle. They are are developers who like to solve customer problems through architecture, presentations and training. Ubuntu is used by pretty much every enterprise in the world, in every industry. This is a fantastic opportunity to learn about the open source technology landscape and develop your business technology insights. You will see first hand in various industries how Linux - and Ubuntu in particular - is shaping innovation and changing the world for the better.

This role is particularly suited to candidates with a technical background who are business minded and driven by commercial success. This role is on our global Field Engineering team and will work closely with enterprise sales leads. We are specifically looking for people interested in solving the most difficult problems in modern data architectures. Training LLMs on multiple K8s clusters deployed on a hybrid cloud infrastructure with GPU sharing across multiple teams? Processing 10M events in real time for financial transactions? Object detection on 10k parallel 4K video streams? These are the problems we solve day to day.

Location: Most of our colleagues work from home. We are growing teams in EMEA, Americas and APAC time zones, so can accommodate candidates from almost any country.

What your day will look like

The global Field Engineering team members are Linux and cloud solutions architects for our customers, designing private and public cloud solutions fitting their workload needs. They are the cloud consultants who work hands-on with the technologies by deploying, testing and handing over the solution to our support or managed services team at the end of a project. They are also software engineers who use Python to develop Kubernetes operators and Linux open source infrastructure-as-code.

  • Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications
  • Architect cloud infrastructure solutions like Kubernetes, Kubeflow, OpenStack, and Spark
  • Deliver solutions either on-premise or in public cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
  • Collect customer business requirements and advise them on Ubuntu and relevant open source applications
  • Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values
  • Deliver presentations and demonstrations of Ubuntu Pro and AI/ML capabilities to prospective and current clients
  • Liaise with product teams to give them feedback on requirements to influence roadmap
  • Work collaboratively with your sales team to reach our common targets
  • Global travel up to 25% of time for internal and external events and 25% to customer meetings

What we are looking for in you

  • Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
  • Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
  • Experience in data engineering, MLOps, or big data solutions deployment
  • Experience with a relevant programming language, like Python, R, or Rust.
  • Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
  • Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
  • Demonstrated personal interest in continuous learning and development
  • Practical knowledge of Linux, virtualisation, containers and networking
  • Business-minded technology thinker and problem solver
  • Knowledge of cloud computing concepts & leaders, such as Kubernetes, AWS, Azure, GCP
  • Interest in large-scale enterprise open source - private clouds, machine learning and AI, data and analytics
  • Intermediate level Python programming skills
  • Passion for technology evidenced by personal projects and initiatives
  • The work ethic and confidence to shine alongside motivated colleagues
  • Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
  • Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
  • A dynamic person who loves to jump in new projects and interact with people
  • Appreciative of diversity, polite and effective in a multi-cultural, multi-national organisation
  • Thoughtfulness and self-motivation
  • Result-oriented, with a personal drive to follow up and meet commitments
  • Ability to travel internationally, for company events up to two weeks long, and customer or industry meetings

What you'll learn

  • Architect and deploy AI/ML infrastructures, data processing pipelines and multi-cluster distributed training
  • Wide range of open source applications and skills
  • Work directly with customers in a range of different businesses
  • Real-life and hands-on exposure to a wide range of emerging technologies and tools

What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.

  • Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
  • Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
  • Annual compensation review
  • Recognition rewards
  • Annual holiday leave
  • Maternity and paternity leave
  • Employee Assistance Programme
  • Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
  • Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Computer Vision Engineer
Description:
I'm partnered with a leading consultancy firm based in Brussels hiring for a Computer Vision enthusiast.




They are seeking a skilled and experienced Computer Vision Engineer to join their dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in computer vision and a passion for developing innovative solutions to real-world problems. You will work closely with our clients to design, implement, and deploy computer vision applications that enhance their business operations.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement computer vision algorithms to solve problems in various domains such as healthcare, automotive, manufacturing, and retail.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand client requirements and deliver customized computer vision solutions.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior engineers and interns.
Document project progress and results, and present findings to clients and stakeholders.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in computer vision and machine learning.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, C++, or Java.
Strong communication skills in English; proficiency in French or Dutch is a plus.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with edge computing and deploying models on edge devices.
Familiarity with augmented reality (AR) and virtual reality (VR) applications.
Knowledge of software development methodologies and tools (e.g., Agile, Git, Docker).




What They Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Company car + fuelcard
NET Allowances.
Insurances
A collaborative and innovative work environment.
Flexible working hours and remote work options.
Access to the latest technology and tools.




If this role is of interest, feel free to contact me on LinkedIn or below:

Number: +31 (0) 203 997 864

Email: Daniel.zelnis@vividresourcing.com

Title: Job | Data Scientist AI Lab | Bruxelles
Description:
Description

Grâce au machine learning (ML) et l'intelligence artificielle (IA), vous générez des produits basés sur les data et vous menez à bien les défis opérationnels les plus urgents.

Votre job en deux mots

Vous contribuez à des projets transversaux dans le AI Lab au sein d'une équipe jeune, dynamique et innovante. Sur le plan IT, le AI Lab collabore avec l’équipe de AI Engineering afin de réaliser les projets IA end-to-end.

Vous utilisez divers types de data, internes et externes, structurées et non structurées, pour améliorer les use cases existants et en lancer de nouveaux. Cela peut se faire pour toutes les activités bancaires et d'assurances : Marketing, Compliance, Risk, fraude, ALM, automatisation des processus…

Votre tâche est très variée :


Vous développez/améliorez des modèles de prévision à l’aide de techniques statistiques et du machine learning.
Vous utilisez des large language models ou d'autres modèles d'IA générative pour fournir des solutions concrètes aux besoins commerciaux.
Vous établissez, analysez et interprétez des hypothèses business et vous exploitez des datasets.
Vous recommandez des idées au business à l’aide de visualisations/algorithmes prévisionnels lorsque des data/résultats sont disponibles.
Vous aidez les utilisateurs à comprendre les principes de la science des données et, si nécessaire, vous commentez les comportements du modèle et les actions de correction possibles.



Pas besoin d’être un oiseau rare

Chez nous, vous pouvez vous distinguer et révéler le meilleur de vous-même si vous répondez aux critères suivants :


Vous avez un master ou un doctorat en sciences, avec d’excellents résultats universitaires sur le plan technique (économétrie, sciences informatiques, intelligence artificielle, etc.).
Vous êtes expert dans les techniques de machine learning et vous êtes disposé à actualiser cette connaissance. Une connaissance approfondie d’algorithmes tels que Random Forests, Neural Networks et Reinforcement Learning est un must.
Vous disposez de solides aptitudes de programmation en Python et SQL.
Vous maîtrisez le français ou le néerlandais et vous avez une connaissance passive de l’autre langue, et de l’anglais.
Grâce à vos compétences narratives et à votre aptitude à visualiser des données, vous êtes capable d’expliquer des analyses complexes à un public profane. Vous disposez d’excellentes capacités de communication écrite et orale au niveau technique et business.
Vous avez soif de connaissances, non seulement pour maîtriser de nouveaux algorithmes et technologies, mais aussi sur le plan interpersonnel. Vous êtes conscient que la valeur de votre travail est synonyme de qualité et d’acceptation et vous tenez à combiner ces deux aspects.
Vous disposez d’une capacité exceptionnelle pour résoudre les problèmes : vous savez qu'une bonne compréhension du problème représente au moins 90% de la solution, vous faites preuve de créativité et de ténacité pour approfondir les problèmes et chercher des solutions.



Vous marquerez encore plus de points si :


Vous êtes bilingue (français/néerlandais).
Vous avez de l’expérience dans le développement de produits data, de la conception à la production.
Vous disposez d'une expérience antérieure du IA générative et/ou Natural Language Processing.
Vous connaissez Spark et les libraries/tools pour les visualisations (comme Plotly/Dash).
Vous avez des notions du cloud, de préférence Azure.



Belfius prend soin de ses talents

Outre la possibilité de faire votre chemin dans un job qui vous plaît, nous vous offrons un contrat à temps plein à durée indéterminée avec :


Un salaire attractif complété par une offre innovante vous octroyant un budget à utiliser selon vos préférences personnelles (p. ex. voiture, vélo, PC, smartphone, tablette, loyer ou crédit hypothécaire sous certaines conditions) et des avantages extralégaux, tels que des chèques-repas, des avantages sur les produits et services internes, une assurance hospitalisation et une assurance groupe.
Des possibilités de développement par le biais d'un large éventail de formations et des opportunités de carrière dans l’ensemble du groupe Belfius
Un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à des horaires flexibles, à la combinaison du travail au bureau et à domicile et un nombre attractif de jours de congé
Un lieu de travail moderne au cœur de Bruxelles, avec une salle de sport branchée, un délicieux restaurant sain et des espaces de réunion confortables, le tout à quelques pas de la rue commerciale, de la gare Bruxelles-Nord et de la station métro Rogier
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description


Build solution accelerators aligned to current business needs and defined use cases.
Assist is development, and deployment of advanced generative models to production.
Optimize and fine-tune existing LLMs/generative models through iterative prompt engineering for improved performance, efficiency.
Develop LLMOps/CI-CD pipeline for timely deployment of new features and updates.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand project requirements and translate them into effective generative AI solutions.
Drive research initiatives to explore cutting-edge advancements in generative AI
Evaluate and integrate relevant AI technologies when applicable, assessing their impact on project objectives.
Documentation of models, algorithms, and implementation processes for knowledge sharing and future reference


Skills Required


Experience in data extraction/transformation techniques using OCRs, Website crawlers and document extractors from websites, social media platforms, PDFs, images, etc.
Strong foundation of NLP, with robust knowledge of Large Language Models (LLM) and Small Language Models (SLM)
In depth understanding of RAG (Vector DB, Knowledge Graph) architecture and Agent Based Framework
Proficient in Prompt engineering techniques (Zero-shot prompting, Chain-of-thought prompts, Contextual augmentation, Human-in-the-loop)
Understanding of foundational deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow, Pytorch, huggingface, etc
Hands on experience with Cloud AI/Cognitive services (preferably Azure) for text/audio/image/video modalities.
Proficiency in Python, Containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), API Development (Fast/Rest), Pyspark and Git.
Nice to have experience in low code UI platform like Streamlit, Gradio, Chainlit for quick POCs
Good in communication and collaboration skills
Show more

Title: Lead Machine Learning Ops Engineer – Banking Client – Brussels
Description:
Lead Machine Learning Ops Engineer – Banking Client – Brussels

Duration: 1 year freelance

Rate: Flexible

Remote Working

My Banking Client in looking for an exceptional ML Ops Engineer on a freelance contract.

Qualifications

You have a proven track record of hands-on experience in the area of AI/ML/Advanced Analytics, with special focus on deploying and maintaining AI/ML models and services in production.
Keywords: AI/ML application development, testing, serving, monitoring, troubleshooting.
You know how to ensure ML models are reproducible and interpretable.
You have already single-handedly packaged and deployed AI/ML services to production.
You know how to monitor and maintain AI/ML services post-deployment.
You are proficient in Python
You have 5+ years of work experience with Python, and AI/ML standard libraries such as pandas, scikit-learn, xgboost
Nice-to-haves:
Data processing libraries and frameworks (pydantic, pandera)
Web frameworks (such as FastAPI, Flask, ...)
CLI frameworks (Typer, Click, ...)
General MLOps tools and frameworks (MLFlow, Azure ML Studio, ...)
Version control tools for ML datasets and models (DVC, Azure ML Dataset, ...)
Monitoring libraries and solutions (such as NannyML, Evidently AI, ...)
Distributed processing libraries and frameworks (such as Ray, Dask, PySpark, ...)
Pipeline-building and orchestration libraries (such as Metaflow, ZenML, Kedro, Airflow, Dagster, ...)
General Python development tool (pytest, coverage, tox, mypy, black, ruff, uv, pip-compile, ...)
You can write both object-oriented and functional code, and understand concepts such as (de)coupling, coherence, inheritance, composition.
You make sure the code that you and your colleagues write is thoroughly tested (unit, integration, end-to-end, stress/performance).
You love and regularly use data validation and type hints.
You know how to turn a messy jupyter notebook into a production-grade piece of code.
Although we'll apply all possible preventive measure to prevent this from ever happening.
You know how to package a python application or library for distribution
You are a proficient GIT user, able to collaborate with multiple developers on multiple repositories, while following best practices related to branching, merging and code reviews.
You have a good understanding of Machine Learning algorithms and their applications in NLP.
You have work experience with at least one Cloud Provider, preferably Azure Cloud.
You have experience with Unix/Linux command line tools and scripting (shell, bash):
VIP club membership if you have at least once ran `rm -rf` on production data.
You possess the foundational Data Engineering skills, allowing you to interact with the Data Engineering team, and analyze and troubleshoot data pipelines if needed:
You could handle using SQL to extract, transform and load data (ETL/ELT).
Experience with the Hadoop ecosystem (Spark, Kafka, Hive, Impala…) is a plus.
Experience with the Cloudera distribution is an additional plus
You understand the modern MLOps framework and complexities it adds to DevOps.
You are able to identify the MLOps maturity gaps and provide inputs for modernization efforts.

Non-technical

You have strong verbal and written communication skills as well as good customer relationship skills to present complex concepts and/or the results of a use case to different audiences (from end users up to division management).
You have experience of working in large, complex enterprises and have stoically accepted it as your fate.
You are not allergic to legacy technology, yet are always on the lookout for modernization opportunities.
You stay up-to-date with new tools, technologies and approaches within the domain.
You are a well-integrated team player.
You are able to estimate your short-term effort with reasonable accuracy and get the work done in the time frame you commit to.
You successfully swim in the waters of Agile project management techniques (scrum boards, standups, demos, reviews).
You stand to promote MLOps and advocate for its usage and necessity across the organization.
Must love mentoring and sharing knowledge.
Must love dad jokes.

Candidates must be based in either Belgium, France, The Netherlands or the UK (IR35 check needed).

Your formal qualifications are the following:

University degree in software engineering OR Data Science/Machine Learning/Data Engineering OR a related quantitative field, combined with strong IT skills.
5+ years of experience with Python
2+ years of experience of using DevOps/CI/CD practices.
2+ years of experience in deploying AI solutions to production.




Please do send across to me the most up to date CV to eobiechefu@welovesalt.com

Show more

  • Distributed processing libraries and frameworks (such as Ray, Dask, PySpark, ...)
  • Pipeline-building and orchestration libraries (such as Metaflow, ZenML, Kedro, Airflow, Dagster, ...)
  • General Python development tool (pytest, coverage, tox, mypy, black, ruff, uv, pip-compile, ...)
  • You can write both object-oriented and functional code, and understand concepts such as (de)coupling, coherence, inheritance, composition.
  • You make sure the code that you and your colleagues write is thoroughly tested (unit, integration, end-to-end, stress/performance).
  • You love and regularly use data validation and type hints.
  • You know how to turn a messy jupyter notebook into a production-grade piece of code.
  • Although we'll apply all possible preventive measure to prevent this from ever happening.
  • You know how to package a python application or library for distribution
  • You are a proficient GIT user, able to collaborate with multiple developers on multiple repositories, while following best practices related to branching, merging and code reviews.
  • You have a good understanding of Machine Learning algorithms and their applications in NLP.
  • You have work experience with at least one Cloud Provider, preferably Azure Cloud.
  • You have experience with Unix/Linux command line tools and scripting (shell, bash):
  • VIP club membership if you have at least once ran `rm -rf` on production data.
  • You possess the foundational Data Engineering skills, allowing you to interact with the Data Engineering team, and analyze and troubleshoot data pipelines if needed:
  • You could handle using SQL to extract, transform and load data (ETL/ELT).
  • Experience with the Hadoop ecosystem (Spark, Kafka, Hive, Impala…) is a plus.
  • Experience with the Cloudera distribution is an additional plus
  • You understand the modern MLOps framework and complexities it adds to DevOps.
  • You are able to identify the MLOps maturity gaps and provide inputs for modernization efforts.

Non-technical

  • You have strong verbal and written communication skills as well as good customer relationship skills to present complex concepts and/or the results of a use case to different audiences (from end users up to division management).
  • You have experience of working in large, complex enterprises and have stoically accepted it as your fate.
  • You are not allergic to legacy technology, yet are always on the lookout for modernization opportunities.
  • You stay up-to-date with new tools, technologies and approaches within the domain.
  • You are a well-integrated team player.
  • You are able to estimate your short-term effort with reasonable accuracy and get the work done in the time frame you commit to.
  • You successfully swim in the waters of Agile project management techniques (scrum boards, standups, demos, reviews).
  • You stand to promote MLOps and advocate for its usage and necessity across the organization.
  • Must love mentoring and sharing knowledge.
  • Must love dad jokes.

Candidates must be based in either Belgium, France, The Netherlands or the UK (IR35 check needed).

Your formal qualifications are the following:

  • University degree in software engineering OR Data Science/Machine Learning/Data Engineering OR a related quantitative field, combined with strong IT skills.
  • 5+ years of experience with Python
  • 2+ years of experience of using DevOps/CI/CD practices.
  • 2+ years of experience in deploying AI solutions to production.


Please do send across to me the most up to date CV to eobiechefu@welovesalt.com

Title: Software Developer
Description:
Software Developer

Data science and Software Development Company

Up to 65K€/year + all Standard Benefits

2 days remote/ Brussels







Who are they?

They develop custom data applications that process data, with AI and machine learning, and deliver insights to the people on the field to improve day-to-day operations.




3 reasons to join this amazing company:

They are experts in Data
Their goal is to empower their teams in making the best out of data
Technology-Driven: They are using big data, AI, and cloud computing

Located in Brussels, they are currently looking for a Full Stack Developer to strengthen their "tech" team.




Who are you?

3 years of hands-on experience with JavaScript (Node.js, ReactJS, React Native, Vue.js, D3.js)
Languages: fluent in English, another European language is a plus
Solid experience with relational databases




Nice to have?

Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field
Any other programming language, for example, Python
Experience with data science is a plus
Certification or experience in AWS




What can you expect?

The possibility to be a part of a young and dynamic team
A permanent, full-time contract
Salary up to 65K€ gross yearly, with all the legal benefits on top (meal voucher, mobility allowance, health insurance…)
2 days remote per week




Interested to know more about this position? Please, do not hesitate to reach me at: c.pinelli@jeffersonfrank.com

Title: Candidature Spontanée - Engineer.
Description:
Découvrez un large éventail de jobs d’ingénieur passionnants!

#CivilEngineering #Oil&Energy

Dans le département Engineering d’Elia, quatre fonctions jouent un rôle crucial :


Nos Program Managers dirigent et gèrent des groupes de projet pour garantir que les investissements dans l’infrastructure aient lieu dans les temps et selon le budget, conformément à notre stratégie au sens large ;
Nos Project Leaders veillent à une exécution sans accroc de chaque projet ;
Le Program and Project Management Office offre un support et formule les avis nécessaires ;
Nos équipes d’experts centralisent les normes et technologies pour les développements futurs en matière d’infrastructure.


Le département Assets est essentiel pour notre cœur de métier. Ses équipes se consacrent à l’exploitation, la gestion et la maintenance de l’infrastructure réseau, avec la sécurité comme priorité absolue. Elles sont disponibles 24 heures sur 24, 7 jours sur 7, intègrent les nouvelles technologies et contribuent à la digitalisation ainsi qu’à la durabilité. Nos équipes dévouées gèrent le cycle de vie complet des assets sur le réseau à haute tension, optimisent les risques, les coûts ainsi que l’impact sur le système et l’environnement.


Les Asset Managers et les Experts déterminent les concepts techniques ainsi que les directives en matière de maintenance et de remplacement ;
Les Maintenance Managers organisent et planifient la maintenance et la mise en service des nouvelles installations ;
Les Program Managers mènent les projets d’innovation et de changement ;
Les ingénieurs d’exploitation dirigent les équipes d’exploitation.


Pour notre NCC (National Control Centre ou centre de contrôle national), nous sommes à la recherche de (Realtime / Close-to-Realtime / Market) System Engineers motivés et flexibles. Dans un paysage énergétique dynamique, caractérisé par une augmentation exponentielle de la capacité renouvelable installée, de nombreux nouveaux acteurs de marché ou de nouvelles technologies sur notre réseau HT, vous jouez un rôle crucial tout au long de l'année dans la gestion de la sécurité du réseau et de l'approvisionnement.

Les facteurs centraux de réussite sont les suivants :


une vue d’ensemble des opérations réseau d’Elia ;
la collaboration avec différents départements ;
une attention pour divers processus et tâches, comme des simulations réseau, la facilitation et la surveillance du marché, les calculs de capacité pour les différents marchés de l'électricité, etc.


Ou que diriez-vous d’un poste passionnant d’ingénieur dans l'équipe Customers, Markets & System (CMS) d’Elia ? Cette équipe joue un rôle essentiel dans la facilitation du marché et est entre autres responsable de nombreux services auxiliaires pour l’exploitation du réseau (comme les réserves d'équilibrage, le black-start, la compensation des pertes, etc.) et de l’exécution de différentes tâches dans les mécanismes de marché pour la sécurité d'approvisionnement (comme le mécanisme de rémunération de la capacité ou CRM).

L'équipe CMS Accueille


des (Extra High voltage) Grid Developers qui conçoivent et développent des systèmes énergétiques et des réseaux électriques pour une distribution optimale de l'électricité ;
des Markets Implementation & Operations Managers qui gèrent l’implémentation et les aspects opérationnels des marchés de l'énergie et veillent à des flux d'électricité efficaces.


#Engineering #ProjectManagement #Consulting #ElectricalElectronicManufacturing

Êtes-vous ce talent Engineering unique que nous cherchons? Faites le test!


Vous avez suivi des études d’ingénieur en électricité, électromécanique, génie civil, courant fort, électronique, etc. ? Check !
Vous parlez couramment le néerlandais ou le français et vous avez une bonne connaissance de l'anglais ? Check !
Vous avez l’esprit d’équipe, êtes orienté(e) résultats et aimez réfléchir à l’innovation au sein d’Elia ? Check !
Vous avez déjà plusieurs années d’expérience professionnelle et vous voulez relever un nouveau défi ? Check !


#Engineering #Consulting

Cela vous intéresse?

Postulez ici et donnez en un éclair un boost à votre carrière ! 💡🚀

Nous chercherons avec vous la fonction qui vous convient le mieux !

Nous sommes convaincus que votre apport à notre équipe vaudra son pesant d’or et avons hâte de vous accueillir prochainement !

Freelance ?

Si vous êtes freelance, veuillez ne pas utiliser les candidatures spontanées sur notre site d'emploi. Vous pouvez envoyer votre CV et votre motivation à elia@contracting.be. Si vous travaillez actuellement en tant qu'indépendant mais que vous envisagez de changer de statut, veuillez l'indiquer clairement dans votre candidature spontanée. Nous nous réjouissons de vous rencontrer !


Show more

Title: Internship Data Science
Description:
Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protecting in the building sector and transportation industry. More than 33,000 employees across 103 countries generated annual sales of CHF 10.5 billion in 2022.

Job Description

Are you a student or a fresh gruadate and interested to gain some practical experience in the field of Data Science? We are offering an interesting 6 months internship starting in September that can provide you just that! For this position you can either be based in Zurich or in Sarnen- depending on your preference. Just be aware that, if based in Zurich, you will have to travel to Sarnen occasionally.

What can you expect? Here is a selection of example assignments:


Analyzing thermoplastic membrane aging along historical and simulated weather data
Image analysis of UV exposed membrane and pattern recognition for micro-cracks
OCR and NLP for location and product information extraction from project documentations


What do we offer?


Dynamic and fun team
Multicultiral environment
Working with senior tech leads both chemical and machine learning domain
Visibility to management if that is perceived motivating
Well defined projects in case school requires formal documentations for credit(s)


Qualifications

Basic understanding of:


At least one programming/scripting language
Database technologies and a query language


Soft Skills


Willingness to learn
Enjoyment of problem solving
English language is needed, German knowledge is advantage


Additional Information


Trust is the foundation of everything we do at Sika: we trust in the competence and capabilities of all our employees – every day.
Built on a foundation of pioneering and entrepreneurial spirit, Sika empowers its people to propose and develop new ideas.
For such a large company, we have a surprisingly flat hierarchy with direct decision-making processes and decentralized organizational units.
