Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Duferco is a global company with diverse interests in energy retail and trading, steel manufacturing, and logistics, where innovation has played a pivotal role in our past successes and now drives our future strategies. Our dedicated Corporate Innovation Team is focused on exploring, nurturing, and implementing innovative ideas, technologies, and strategies to propel our organization to new heights. While operating with the agility of startups, this team maintains a corporate vision and takes the lead in recognizing and capitalizing on opportunities for growth, efficiency, and competitiveness.

As we continue to expand and diversify our operations, we are seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. Your role will be pivotal in advancing our mission of using advanced analytics and machine learning models to drive excellence across our diverse portfolio of businesses. If you have a genuine passion for pushing the boundaries of applied data science, acting swiftly, and exploring technologies that can make a substantial impact on our business, we eagerly await your application.




Responsibilities:

Develop, implement, and optimize data science solutions for several applications, ranging from industrial manufacturing to energy retail and trading.
Ensure the robustness, scalability, and peak efficiency of deployed models in production environments.
Dedicate time to understand our business needs and collect feedback from the field to empower data science solutions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data-driven solutions into existing systems and processes or help define new ones.
Collect, preprocess, and analyze large datasets to train and validate AI models.
Ensure the delivery of solutions that are accurate and demonstrate high attention to detail.
Proactively scout and evaluate emerging technologies that can be leveraged within our company's operations.




Qualifications:

A Master's degree with some years of working experience, or a Ph.D., in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Hands-on experience with Python and open-source data science and machine learning frameworks and libraries.
Experience handling structured and unstructured data, data pipelines, ETL, and data organization in databases, data warehouses, and data lakes.
Familiarity with computer vision and/or natural language processing techniques (nice-to-have).
Familiarity with mathematical programming and optimization techniques (nice-to-have).
Experience in crafting end-to-end data-driven solutions.




How to Apply:

If you are a proficient Data Scientist with a track record of successful projects, contributions to open-source library development, competition participation, or personal projects, we encourage you to seize this opportunity. Please share your resume, relevant publications, or project portfolios: hr.ch@duferco.com. Only suitable profiles will be contacted.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer in a fast-growing AI Startup
Description:
At the ETH spin-off Lightly, we build software solutions to help companies improve their deep learning models. The available data for deep learning grows faster than human tagging and available compute power. Our customers already face this problem and have too much data to process. As a solution, we built software to identify and work with the most relevant samples only. Learn more about us on our website.

We are a team of talented developers and researchers in Zurich, Prague and San Francisco and are backed by YCombinator. Every member of the team is going to have a massive impact.

Thus, we are looking for an experienced engineer with lots of passion for the subject. We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.

We use a modern stack of:


PyTorch, Python, Typescript, C++, Rust, React, NodeJS
Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS



Tasks

As a Machine Learning Engineer in the core ML team, you will be part of a team which works mainly on our open-source package for self-supervised learning and similar internal frameworks.

Particularly, you will get to:


Work on our open-source Python package for self-supervised learning: https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.
Add support for finetuning pretrained models for downstream tasks including many different computer vision tasks like object detection, segmentation, tracking, and more.
Keep up with current research in self-supervised learning and multi-modal models.
All these tasks will include working with state-of-the-art technology such as self-supervised learning, model distillation, vision language models and deep learning for computer vision in general.
Participate in and hold paper sessions about the latest papers in the field.
Represent the company at machine learning conferences and engage with the community.



In general, for this role expect to use the stack we use for our open-source package https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.

Requirements

Ideally, you have:


MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Experience in deep learning and computer vision, ideally in self-supervised learning and you have worked with PyTorch.
Excellent Python coding skills and knowledge of software engineering best practices. Experience with testing and typed Python is a big plus.
Experience with building and shipping software solutions.
Strong passion for new technologies and interest in keeping up with the latest technologies and publications in deep learning.



Benefits

We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.

Interested? Contact us!

We look forward to getting to know you!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer

On behalf of our Pharmaceutical client in Basel, we are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer with experience in machine learning or MLOps, ideally within the life sciences domain, to support the development of data-driven solutions.
Knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs) and LLM-based multi-agent frameworks from the perspective of an engineer is required.

This role requires good skills in software development and team working.

The perfect candidate:

Strong Programming Skills: Proficiency in Python, with a solid understanding of software development principles and best practices.
REST API Design: Deep knowledge and experience in designing and implementing RESTful APIs.
CI/CD and DevOps: Experience with Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment using GitLab, GitOps, and Kubernetes for hosting services is advantageous.
Familiarity with implementing user interfaces is a plus.
High-Performance Computing: Prior experience working in HPC environments is beneficial.


General Information:

* Start date: 15.8.2024
* Planned duration: 6 months
* Extension (in case of limitation): possible
* Workplace: Basel
* Workload: 100%
* Remote/Home Office:partial

Title: Data Scientist / Optimization Specialist
Description:
We are seeking a Data Scientist / Optimization Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will be an expert in optimization/operational-research and high-performance, with the ability to address complex business problems using mathematical optimization or machine learning techniques. They will play a crucial role in translating business challenges into mathematical optimization problems and then developing innovative computational solutions. We expect you to be autonomous and able to learn (methodologies, technologies, domains) and adapt to a fast-moving environment.




Key Responsibilities:

Identify and articulate business problems that can be addressed through optimization, by collaborating with cross-functional teams.
Develop and implement mathematical models to optimize business processes and decision-making.
Develop and implement computational efficient solutions.
When necessary, utilize high-performance computing infrastructures to analyze and solve optimization problems efficiently.
While not mandatory, familiarity with quantum computing is a plus, as the candidate should be capable of understanding and modeling problems in a compatible "canonic" form – to make the solutions quantum ready, when relevant.
While not mandatory, experience in insurance and/or financial services (on topics such as advanced pricing, underwriting, reserving, or reinsurance) will be considered highly valuable.







Qualifications:

Advanced degree in optimization, operational-research, mathematics, computer science, or a related field OR an actuarial degree.
Proven experience in applying optimization and operational research techniques to real-world business challenges.
Proficiency in programming languages such as C, C++ or Cuda, but also Python.
Flexibility and Growth Mindset: We are seeking individuals who thrive in a dynamic and evolving environment, where learning and embracing new challenges are essential. The ideal candidates should demonstrate a strong willingness to continuously expand their knowledge, adapt to new technologies, and take on diverse and evolving responsibilities.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Languages: English (mandatory) and French (appreciated).

Title: Data Scientist (6033)
Description:
The Life Science Career Network

CTC are specialised industry experts who help companies source the best talent and provide reliable HR and consulting services. We support candidates in finding promising career opportunities and offer the latest in skill development training programs.




Our client is a leading global player in the pharmaceutical industry with headquarters in Basel, Switzerland. They focus on novel therapies in Oncology and Ophthalmology, and are developing a world-leading pipeline in Neuroscience and Dermatology, boasting one of the strongest Phase II/III pipelines globally.




Data Scientist (6-month contract - Basel, CH)




About the Role:

The Data Scientist will work with quantitative scientists, domain experts, and product developers to ensure teams succeed in answering scientific questions using the client's platform. They will apply and develop analytical methods and predictive models that impact research and drug development programs, and collaborate on analytical pipelines that can be reused across the platform. They will also advocate for good data science practices and contribute to the design of the platform, making it accessible and useful for the data science and AI community.




Key Responsibilities:

Enable and support scientific teams to achieve their goals using the client's platform.
Accelerate data science through the development of reusable pipelines for data preparation and analysis.
Develop frameworks for generating and reporting key results, quality benchmarks for data, models, and impact in collaboration with data scientist users.
Apply expertise in machine learning, deep learning, data visualization, and structured/unstructured data analytics to achieve scientific goals.
Advocate for good data science practices.




Requirements:

At least 2 years of professional experience in the pharmaceutical sector.
Experience with bioinformatics (DNA/RNA/proteomics data analysis), statistical genetics, and/or biostatistics.
Strong experience with R or Python for data analysis and statistical modeling.
Experience using machine learning models to predict clinical endpoints using multimodal data.
Experience with AI/GenAI/LLMs for automating or accelerating data science-related processes.
Familiarity with principles and tools of good data science practices (e.g., Git/versioning).
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.




Desirable Additional Skills:

Knowledge of CDISC data standards (SDTM, ADaM).
Experience with pooling clinical trial data.
Understanding of the drug discovery and development process.
Experience in Immunology or Cardiology/Renal/Metabolic diseases.
Experience with computational environments for large-scale data science (e.g., high-performance computing or Spark).
Statistical and machine learning, and/or applied deep learning methods for time series data.
Experience using the Foundry platform for data analysis.




Would you like to learn more about CTC and this opportunity? Please contact us by using the 'apply now' button or write an email to vanessa.gilardoni@ctcresourcing.com

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer - Decarbonising Real Estate - ₣110k + Shares - Brilliant Climate-Tech Start-Up - Hybrid




One of Europe's most innovative Climate-Tech Start-Ups (Winner of the 2024 Tech of the Year Award) has created groundbreaking technology to move beyond the era of dirty buildings and bring Net Zero Real Estate closer to reality.




We are looking for a tech-passionate & bright Machine Learning Engineer who wants to put their skills towards addressing climate change & making a big difference. A team of some of the brightest minds in Europe, from 9 different countries, we embrace a fantastic culture and truly value hard work.




We are a fast-growing startup with a mission to decarbonise real estate - with backing from world-leading Climate-Tech VC's and Innovation Endeavors (San Francisco – fund of former Google CEO Eric Schmidt).




What you'll do:




Participate in the enhancement of our decision-making models.
Create and design predictive models for constructing signals.
Conceive new methods for extracting and combining publicly accessible data. Guide the product's direction and data partnerships.
Devise innovative solutions to address our customers' issues.
Manage the entire development process: from specifications to production implementation. Work with colleagues on architecture, design, and code reviews.




Who we are seeking:




Highly Self-Motivated: You can efficiently and promptly carry out tasks, demonstrating strong initiative and self-drive.
You Get Things Done: You prioritize speed and flexibility, adept at making swift compromises to maintain momentum, while delivering quality results.
Lateral thinker: You regularly step back to look at the broader picture. Changing the problem is sometimes faster and better than investing two weeks in a fancy ML model.
Analytical and Self-Reflective: You analyze your performance and continuously seek ways to improve.
Compassionate and Humorous: You bring kindness and humor to the team, enhancing both morale and collaboration.




Essential requirements:




MSc in Computer Science, Math, Physics or equivalent.
Broad algorithmic knowledge: dynamic programming, graphs algorithms, data structures, etc.
Broad ML knowledge: convex optimization, supervised learning, unsupervised learning, etc. Outstanding programming skills (Python, C++, C).
Ability to contribute individually and in teams.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
Swiss or EU citizenship (unfortunately due to size, we can’t support non-EU).




Desirable qualifications




2+ years of professional experience in software development or data science.
Broad financial/real estate knowledge.
Experience with cloud products (GCP or AWS).




Benefits:




Significant impact on the product and strategy from the start.
Continuous learning opportunities in a growth-focused culture.
CHF 1k learning and development budget for conferences and certifications.
100% coverage of non-occupational accident insurance (UVG).
25 days of paid vacation and flexible parental leave.
Mainly based in our Zürich office, with some remote work and flexible hours available.




Venchr is an equal-opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation. All applicants will receive consideration for employment based on their talent, skillset and individual merit alone.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
(Permanent, Zurich)




For one of our clients in Zurich, we are looking for a Data Scientist. The right candidate will be responsible for the further development and setup of data, analytics, ML/AI use cases from ideation, business analysis, prototype development to go-live.

The team is growing and is shaping their future of advanced data analysis and AI use cases (machine learning, NLP/LLM, computer vision, etc.) and makes them usable for their business.




Responsibilities:

Oversee the lifecycle of data products: requirement gathering, data engineering, ML/DL training/testing, result visualisation, and operationalisation.
Extract insights from business data using advanced analytics.
Develop data-driven models in NLP, computer vision, ML, and deep learning to address business questions.
Support business stakeholders in data and analytics projects, from ideation to scalable ML/AI solution implementation.
Collaborate closely with Group IT teams.




Requirements:

Degree in computer science, business informatics, statistics, or related field.
Experience with financial, project, and IoT data.
Proficiency in Python and ML/DL libraries.
Knowledge of cloud-based data analytics platforms, preferably Microsoft Azure.
Understanding of microservice architectures and container technologies (e.g., Docker).
Familiarity with agile development, integration technologies, and DevOps practices.
Strong communication skills, initiative, team orientation, and creativity.
Excellent German and English skills.




If you are interested, please apply with your updated CV for a discussion.

Due to immigration restrictions in Switzerland we will only be able to consider applications from Swiss or EU citizens or from candidates holding a valid Swiss work permit.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist (M/F/D)

Tasks:

Ensure that scientific teams are enabled and supported to achieve their goals at data42
Contributes to the acceleration of data science through activities such as the development of reusable pipelines for the data preparation and analyses
Develops frameworks for generation and reporting of key results, quality benchmarks for data, models, and impact in collaboration with our data scientist users.
Applies their expertise in machine learning, deep learning, data visualization and structured/unstructured data analytics towards the scientific goals of their team.
Acts as an advocate for good data science practice across data42
Ensure that scientific teams are enabled and supported to achieve their goals at data42
Contributes to the acceleration of data science through activities such as the development of reusable pipelines for the data preparation and analyses
Develops frameworks for generation and reporting of key results, quality benchmarks for data, models, and impact in collaboration with our data scientist users.
Applies their expertise in machine learning, deep learning, data visualization and structured/unstructured data analytics towards the scientific goals of their team.
Acts as an advocate for good data science practice across data42

Qualification:

PhD in a quantitative / computational science (e.g. bioinformatics, engineering, machine learning, statistics, physics, mathematics, ...)
Languages: Fluent in English (oral and written)
At least 2 years of professional experience in the pharmaceutical sector
Experience with bioinformatics (around DNA / RNA / proteomics data analysis) and/or statistical genetics and/or biostatistics
Strong experience with R or python for data analysis and statistical modelling
Experience in using machine learning models to predict clinical endpoints using multimodal data
Experience with use of AI/GenAI/LLMs for automating or accelerating data- or data science related processes
Experience with the principles and tools of good data science practice (e.g git/versioning …).
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Desirable additional skills in two or more of the following areas:
Knowledge of CDISC data standard (SDTM, ADaM),
Experience with pooling of clinical trial data
Understanding of the drug discovery and development process
Experience working in the field of Immunology or Cardiology/Renal/Metabolic diseases
Experience with computational environments for large-scale data science (e.g. high-performance computing or Spark),
Statistical and machine learning, and / or applied deep learning methods for time series data.
Experience in using the Foundry platform for data analysis

Requirements:

Start: 01.08.2024

Duration: 5 months

Capacity: 5 days per week

Location: Basel, Switzerland

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Senior Data Scientist




DXT Commodities, for its Lugano office, is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join the Power Analytics team, as a part of the European Power Trading desk. The team mission is the application of advanced statistical and quantitative methodologies to extract value from various and extra-large data sets.

We are searching for a person passionate about quantitative problem solving and keen to explore business implications through continuous interactions within the team.

If you are looking for a challenge in your next career step, this is a truly exciting opportunity for you to apply your advanced statistical skills in our dynamic and exciting team.




Main responsibilities:

The statistical problems to solve will require exposure to multivariate time series and functional data analysis with particular focus on bottom-up physics augmented machine learning algorithms.

The successful applicant will develop, maintain, and improve forecasting models to provide quantitative support to traders.




Requirements:

Strong academic background in STEM fields.
At least three years of combined post-graduate research/professional experience in developing statistical models with a verifiable track record of contributions
Proficiency in Python (R, MLOP and code versioning nice to have)
Willingness to keep up with machine learning and AI advances
Fluency in English, a second European language is a plus




Offer:

Permanent position with very attractive remuneration package
Young, dynamic and highly skilled professional environment




About DXT Commodities:

DXT Commodities SA is an international commodities trading company, active in the European wholesale power and natural gas markets and leader in the offtake of renewable energy, with over 3.5 GW of installed capacity managed.

Please send your CV together with a cover letter to: hr.datanalysis@dxtcommodities.com

Only suitable profiles will be contacted.

By submitting your application you consent to the processing of your personal data by DXT Commodities SA as per the applicable privacy laws and regulations and agree that your data shall be held for the retention period specified in the relevant data protection laws.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
One of our major clients, are looking for a Data Scientist (Biostatistician) to work alongside quantitative scientists, domain experts and product developers to ensure teams succeed in answering scientific questions, and to help our users to apply and develop analytical methods and predictive models that deliver impact on research and drug development programs.

We are looking for data scientist bringing expertise in one or more of the following areas:

Cardiovascular
Renal




Responsibilities:

Ensure that scientific teams are enabled and supported to achieve their goals
Contributes to the acceleration of data science through activities such as the development of reusable pipelines for the data preparation and analyses
Develops frameworks for generation and reporting of key results, quality benchmarks for data, models, and impact in collaboration with our data scientist users.
Applies their expertise in machine learning, deep learning, data visualization and structured/unstructured data analytics towards the scientific goals of their team.




Requirements:

Master, or PhD in a quantitative / computational science (e.g. bioinformatics, machine learning, statistics, physics, mathematics, ...),
Strong experience with Python for data analysis (scikit-learn, numpy, …),
Experience with R for data analysis (tidyverse, mlr, ...) would be an advantage.




To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience to jtoma@actalentservices.com

Title: AI Engineer (LLM) (100% remote - Europe)
Description:
At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

The role involves building AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops.

Our dynamic team operates entirely remotely, uniting talent from every corner of the globe. Our journey has been marked by rapid growth and efficient operations, firmly establishing us as pioneers within the industry. Join us in building AI models and solutions that not only compete with but exceed the capabilities of current leaders, driving both technological advancement and broad accessibility.

What You'll Do:


Research and Development of multimodal AI models that set new industry standards.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure our AI models are effectively integrated into market-driven solutions.
A degree in Computer Science. Ideally Masters in Machine learning in computer science.
Experience building a LLM or other large models from scratch including writing model code, gathering training data, optimizing training and inference.
Strong experience in NLP, multimodal learning, proficient in TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
Excellent programming skills in Python, C++, JavaScript or similar.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientists at QuantCo will learn what it takes to create impact from data: identifying the right framework to translate a business question into a statistical problem; locating and combining data sources as well as transforming large datasets; running in-depth analyses; building machine learning models that automate large-scale decisions and integrating them into live business processes; and interpreting, visualizing, and communicating results to internal and external stakeholders.

We are looking for team players who have excellent quantitative abilities and:


A degree in economics, statistics, mathematics, computer science, engineering, physics, or similar fields
In-depth understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts behind most common machine learning techniques and a proven interest in causal inference questions, e.g., A/B tests
Experience in coding and working with data (from a previous research or industry internship or extensive course projects) using a wide range of tools and languages: Python (Pandas, XGBoost/LightGBM), R (dplyr, ggplot2), and git
Ability to see solutions and opportunities that others do not see
High level of commitment and reliability, good balance of pragmatism and perfectionism
Business proficiency in German



Bonus if skilled in any of the following tools and/or languages:


SQL
Tensorflow
Keras
Cloud infrastructure
Docker
Lower-level languages like C#/C++/C



What We Offer

You will be part of a smart, motivated, and driven team that revels in working on challenging problems and finding novel solutions; values our customers and users; and strives to deliver thoughtful and impactful products. You will be surrounded by people that respect each other and the contributions each of us brings. We offer a generous compensation package that includes a base salary, bonus, stock options, and relocation support along with additional location-based benefits.

About QuantCo

At QuantCo, we leverage expertise in data science, engineering, and economics to help organizations turn data into decisions. Started by 4 PhDs from Harvard and Stanford, we are now more than 180 professionals with extensive quantitative, engineering, and business experience. We are globally distributed with offices in Berlin, Boston, Cologne, Karlsruhe, London, Munich, San Francisco, and Zurich.

Our solutions include algorithmic pricing, data-driven claims management, and high-dimensional forecasting systems. Our customers include some of the largest financial, retail, and healthcare organizations in the US and Europe. We impact core business processes and decisions by combining advanced data-driven insights with scalable engineering solutions.

We are excited about writing mission-critical code that affects millions of people and impacts billions of dollars. If you feel the same way, we look forward to hearing from you.

QuantCo does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist / Large Language Model (LLM) Specialist
Description:
We are in search of a talented researcher/machine learning specialist to join our team as a Data Scientist with a focus on Large Language Models (LLM). The ideal candidate will possess a high level of proficiency in data science and demonstrate a strong emphasis on leveraging large language models. This person should have a deep technical understanding of machine learning, complemented by solid programming skills. We expect you to be autonomous and able to learn. Be ready to regularly learn new things (methodologies, technologies, domains) and adapt to a fast-moving environment.







Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement cutting-edge machine learning algorithms and models, with a specific emphasis on large language models incl. agents, fine-tuning, new transformers-based architectures.
Stay updated and share advancement on the state of the art.
Participate in local academic partnerships, and ideally develop and drive them.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to (a) share expertise and advice, and (b) implement some of the advanced solutions developed to solve complex business challenges.
More generally, contribute to the innovation and advancement of machine learning capabilities within the organization.
While not mandatory, experience in insurance and/or financial services will be considered a valuable asset.







Qualifications:

A solid background as a researcher and/or data scientist, or a strong interest in technical excellence and machine learning innovation.
In-depth knowledge of machine learning, deep learning and data science is mandatory. In-depth knowledge of natural language processing and in particular large language models is highly appreciated.
Exposure to the LLM’s ecosystem and associated frameworks.
Proficiency of Python, Jupyter Notebook and popular neural network frameworks (Tensorflow and/or PyTorch), along with a good understanding of software engineering principles.
Experience in training Machine Learning models on large data sets.
Open to continuous improvement of Data Science skills: we are seeking individuals who thrive in a dynamic and evolving environment, where learning and embracing new challenges are essential. The ideal candidates should demonstrate a strong willingness to continuously expand their knowledge, adapt to new technologies, and take on diverse and evolving responsibilities.
Team player, fruitful interactions with the other team members and external stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Languages: English (mandatory) and French (appreciated).

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
📢 Notre mission :




Ivy Partners est une société de conseil Suisse qui contribue à l’évolution des entreprises dans leurs enjeux stratégiques, technologiques et organisationnels.

Notre objectif aujourd’hui est d’offrir à nos collaborateurs une carrière qui contribuera positivement à leur épanouissement et à leur bien-être, en les faisant monter en compétences et en leur offrant de réelles perspectives d’évolution.







👩‍💻🧑‍💻 En tant que Data Scientist chez Ivy Partners, vous serez en charge de :




Analyser les demandes métiers et les convertir en cas d’usage data science
Définir et construire les solutions correspondant aux besoins.
Travailler en collaboration avec différents intervenants.
Identifier, modéliser et développer des projets de bout en bout.
Déployer, maintenir et améliorer les solutions.










🏅 À propos de vous !




Vous êtes notre petite pépite si techniquement :




Vous avez au moins 6 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Scientist sur l’analyse de documents dans un but de classification.
Expertise en fouille de données à l'aide d'outils statistiques type SAS ou R.
Vous maitrisez Python.
Vous avez des connaissances en Machine learning, Deep learning, computer vision et OCR.
Expertise sur les bases de données NOSQL et MongoDB.
Vous aimez industrialiser et valoriser le résultat de votre travail.
Vous avez évolué dans un environnement agile, notamment Scrum et Safe.







Et si humainement :




Vous êtes organisé.e, rigoureux/se, autonome et avez un bon esprit d’équipe.
Vous êtes force de proposition pour des nouveautés et du changement.
Vous êtes à l’aise avec différents interlocuteurs et savez vulgariser.










🤝 Ivy Partners, c’est aussi :




La bienveillance | Soucieux de nos employés, nous leur garantissons un environnement favorable où chacun est valorisé et se voit offrir des formations et des perspectives d’évolution en Suisse ou à l’international.

La confiance | Travailler avec nous, c’est développer un partenariat fondé sur la confiance, le professionnalisme et la transparence à chaque instant.

L’innovation | Nous garantissons une transformation numérique efficace grâce à l’innovation technologique couplée à la créativité.

La responsabilité | Le collectif est à la base de tout ce que nous entreprenons, et nous prenons cette responsabilité au sérieux en mettant tout en œuvre pour avoir un impact positif.







🚀 Rejoindre Ivy, c’est prendre part à une aventure stimulante à chaque instant ! Merci d’envisager de nous rejoindre, nous sommes impatients d’en savoir plus sur vous !

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The Life Science Career Network

CTC are specialised industry experts who help companies source the best talent and provide reliable HR and consulting services. We support candidates in finding promising career opportunities and offer the latest in skill development training programs.

Our client is a leading global player in the pharmaceutical industry with headquarters in Basel, Switzerland. They focus on novel therapies in Oncology and Ophthalmology, and are developing a world-leading pipeline in Neuroscience and Dermatology, boasting one of the strongest Phase II/III pipelines globally.

Data Scientist (6-month contract)

About The Role

The Data Scientist will work with quantitative scientists, domain experts, and product developers to ensure teams succeed in answering scientific questions using the client's platform. They will apply and develop analytical methods and predictive models that impact research and drug development programs, and collaborate on analytical pipelines that can be reused across the platform. They will also advocate for good data science practices and contribute to the design of the platform, making it accessible and useful for the data science and AI community.

Key Responsibilities


Enable and support scientific teams to achieve their goals using the client's platform.
Accelerate data science through the development of reusable pipelines for data preparation and analysis.
Develop frameworks for generating and reporting key results, quality benchmarks for data, models, and impact in collaboration with data scientist users.
Apply expertise in machine learning, deep learning, data visualization, and structured/unstructured data analytics to achieve scientific goals.
Advocate for good data science practices.


Requirements


At least 2 years of professional experience in the pharmaceutical sector.
Experience with bioinformatics (DNA/RNA/proteomics data analysis), statistical genetics, and/or biostatistics.
Strong experience with R or Python for data analysis and statistical modeling.
Experience using machine learning models to predict clinical endpoints using multimodal data.
Experience with AI/GenAI/LLMs for automating or accelerating data science-related processes.
Familiarity with principles and tools of good data science practices (e.g., Git/versioning).
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.


Desirable Additional Skills


Knowledge of CDISC data standards (SDTM, ADaM).
Experience with pooling clinical trial data.
Understanding of the drug discovery and development process.
Experience in Immunology or Cardiology/Renal/Metabolic diseases.
Experience with computational environments for large-scale data science (e.g., high-performance computing or Spark).
Statistical and machine learning, and/or applied deep learning methods for time series data.
Experience using the Foundry platform for data analysis.


Would you like to learn more about CTC and this opportunity? Please contact us by using the 'apply now' button or write an email to vanessa.gilardoni@ctcresourcing.com
Show more

Title: Data Scientist – Pharma, bioinformatics
Description:
Data Scientist requiring profound Pharma and Bioinformatics knowledge vacancy for a globally operating Basel based company in the pharmaceutical sector.

Your Tasks


Supporting scientific teams in achieving their goals
Developing reusable pipelines for data preparation and analyses
Creating frameworks for generating key results and quality benchmarks
Appling machine learning and deep learning expertise to scientific objectives
Advocating for good data science practices



Your Experience/knowledge


2+ years of experience in the pharmaceutical sector
Expertise in omics data analysis, Immunology, Cardiology, Renal, Metabolic diseases, or large-scale data computation
Proficiency in R or Python for data analysis and statistical modeling
Experience with machine learning models for predicting clinical endpoints
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
PhD in a quantitative or computational science such as bioinformatics, machine learning or statistics



Location: Basel, Switzerland

Work setting: On-site

Sector: Pharma

Start: ASAP

Duration: 05MM+

Workload: 100%

Ref.Nr.: BH21925

Take the next step and send us your resume along with a daytime phone number where we can reach you.

Due to Swiss work permit restrictions, we can only consider applications from Swiss nationals, EU citizens as well as current work-permit holders for Switzerland.

Ukrainian refugees are warmly welcomed, we will support you all the way.

We welcome applications from individuals of all genders, age groups, sexual orientations, personal expressions, ethnic backgrounds, and religious beliefs. Therefore, there is no requirement to provide gender information or a photo in your application.

As per client requirements, we need information about your marital status, nationality, date of birth, and a valid Swiss work permit. For applicants with disabilities, we are happy to explore potential solutions with our end client.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About TSG

Technology Staffing Group SA is a Swiss IT consulting group based in Geneva. Expertise in hiring IT talents as well as co-leading projects for our clients which include start-ups to Fortune 500 companies that are based across Europe. Today, more than 100 employees across Europe support our clients in accelerating and transforming their organizations.

We are seeking Senior and Junior Data Scientists to join our clients' team, focusing on the healthcare sector. These roles offer an exciting opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making.

Position


Data Scientist



Experience Required


Minimum 2 years of experience in business analysis, focusing on advanced data analytics projects
Minimum 2 years of hands-on experience in data mining using statistical tools such as SAS or R
Minimum 2 years of experience in developing machine learning and deep learning algorithms
Minimum 2 years of experience in data warehouse modeling
Minimum 2 years of experience with NoSQL databases, preferably MongoDB
Demonstrated experience in Python application development with at least 2 projects



Main Responsibilities


Apply expertise in business analysis to understand and analyze complex business problems, and translate them into data science solutions
Utilize statistical tools such as SAS or R for data mining, exploratory data analysis, and predictive modeling to extract actionable insights from large datasets
Develop and deploy machine learning and deep learning algorithms to solve business problems and optimize processes
Design and optimize data warehouse models for efficient data storage and retrieval
Utilize NoSQL databases, particularly MongoDB, for managing and analyzing large-scale data sets
Develop and maintain Python-based applications for data manipulation, analysis, and visualization
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs, provide analytical support, and present findings in a clear and compelling manner



Education/Certification


Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related quantitative field.



Languages


French: Native/Fluent
English: Fluent



Next steps


Our team of recruitment managers is your first point of contact. Their role is to understand your background, to consider your life project and your expectations to offer you missions that suit you.
Depending on your area of expertise, we offer the opportunity to discuss technical topics with one of our colleagues.
Context, constitution of the team in place, objectives, technical expertise requested, challenges to be met: this interview with a Business Manager allows you to better know the assignment or projects on which we could be required to work together.
You will finally have interviews with our clients to meet your future teammates and better understand your work assignment environment.
Your profile is accepted by one of our clients? Congrats and welcome to the TSG community!



Your personal data


By submitting your resume, you accept that the data entered will be retained, reused by TSG to contact you and shared with our clients in the context of your request.

  • Apply expertise in business analysis to understand and analyze complex business problems, and translate them into data science solutions
  • Utilize statistical tools such as SAS or R for data mining, exploratory data analysis, and predictive modeling to extract actionable insights from large datasets
  • Develop and deploy machine learning and deep learning algorithms to solve business problems and optimize processes
  • Design and optimize data warehouse models for efficient data storage and retrieval
  • Utilize NoSQL databases, particularly MongoDB, for managing and analyzing large-scale data sets
  • Develop and maintain Python-based applications for data manipulation, analysis, and visualization
  • Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs, provide analytical support, and present findings in a clear and compelling manner


Education/Certification

  • Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related quantitative field.


Languages

  • French: Native/Fluent
  • English: Fluent


Next steps

  • Our team of recruitment managers is your first point of contact. Their role is to understand your background, to consider your life project and your expectations to offer you missions that suit you.
  • Depending on your area of expertise, we offer the opportunity to discuss technical topics with one of our colleagues.
  • Context, constitution of the team in place, objectives, technical expertise requested, challenges to be met: this interview with a Business Manager allows you to better know the assignment or projects on which we could be required to work together.
  • You will finally have interviews with our clients to meet your future teammates and better understand your work assignment environment.
  • Your profile is accepted by one of our clients? Congrats and welcome to the TSG community!


Your personal data

  • By submitting your resume, you accept that the data entered will be retained, reused by TSG to contact you and shared with our clients in the context of your request.

Title: Data Scientist - Pharma, bioinformatics
Description:
Data Scientist requiring profound Pharma and Bioinformatics knowledge vacancy for a globally operating Basel based company in the pharmaceutical sector.

Your Tasks


Supporting scientific teams in achieving their goals
Developing reusable pipelines for data preparation and analyses
Creating frameworks for generating key results and quality benchmarks
Appling machine learning and deep learning expertise to scientific objectives
Advocating for good data science practices


Your Experience/knowledge


2+ years of experience in the pharmaceutical sector
Expertise in omics data analysis, Immunology, Cardiology, Renal, Metabolic diseases, or large-scale data computation
Proficiency in R or Python for data analysis and statistical modelling
Experience with machine learning models for predicting clinical endpoints
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
PhD in a quantitative or computational science such as bioinformatics, machine learning or statistics


Location: Basel, Switzerland

Work setting: On-site

Sector: Pharma

Start: ASAP

Duration: 05MM+

Workload: 100%

Ref.Nr.: BH21925

Take the next step and send us your resume along with a daytime phone number where we can reach you.

Due to Swiss work permit restrictions, we can only consider applications from Swiss nationals, EU citizens as well as current work-permit holders for Switzerland.

Ukrainian refugees are warmly welcomed, we will support you all the way.

We welcome applications from individuals of all genders, age groups, sexual orientations, personal expressions, ethnic backgrounds, and religious beliefs. Therefore, there is no requirement to provide gender information or a photo in your application.

As per client requirements, we need information about your marital status, nationality, date of birth, and a valid Swiss work permit. For applicants with disabilities, we are happy to explore potential solutions with our end client.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
JOB PURPOSE

Are you passionate about uncovering insights from data and driving innovative solutions? Do you excel at solving complex problems and developing advanced models? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Scientist to join our dynamic Revenue Management team. In this role, you'll harness your expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning to optimise our revenue strategies.


KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

• Analyse large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for revenue growth.

• Develop and implement predictive models to forecast demand and optimise pricing strategies.

• Apply time series analysis and machine learning theory to improve demand forecasting and inventory management.

• Manage and improve interactive web applications for data visualisation.

• Perform web scraping to gather external data relevant to revenue management.

• Generate actionable insights from data analysis to support decision-making processes.

• Present findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner.

• Review and document code to ensure clarity, maintainability, and best practices.

• Stay current with industry trends and advancements in data science methodologies.


QUALIFICATIONS

• Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.

• Proven experience as a Data Scientist, preferably in the travel, hospitality, or related industries.

• Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and SQL.

• Experience with TensorFlow, Keras, Streamlit, Prophet.

• Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.

• Knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, and time series analysis.

• Excellent communication and presentation skills.

• Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

• Knowledge of web scraping techniques and tools.

• Proven capability to industrialise models and implement solutions into production environments.

• Experience with deploying applications and models using Docker, Jenkins, and other similar tools.

• Strong skills in ETL processes and data architecture.


VISA REQUIREMENTS

EU Passport or Right to work in Switzerland.

Show more

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Our client is a ML focused consultancy who are looking for a talented ML Engineer to join their innovative team. They partner with start-ups and scale-ups to build initial AI components, as well as assisting larger companies in developing their comprehensive ML capabilities. Why Join the team?




• 🌍 Location: Basel office with hybrid working flexibility •

🚀 Start Date: August/September




Role Highlights:

• 💡 Innovate: Identify and capitalize on new business and product opportunities

• 🤖 Inspire: Challenge and inspire the team with state-of-the-art applied ML

• 🛠️ Build: Analyze problems, develop solutions, and ensure successful delivery

• 📊 Develop: Perform preprocessing, feature engineering, and dataset creation

• 🔍 Validate: Develop ML models and validate their results

• 📈 Pipeline: Develop robust data pipelines and infrastructure




Technical Stack:

• 🖥️ Languages & Libraries: Python, Scikit-learn, specialized Python and R ML libraries

• 🧠 Deep Learning: Pytorch, TensorFlow/Keras

• ☁️ Cloud Platforms: GCP, AWS, Azure

• 🗄️ Databases: Relational databases

• ⚙️ Distributed Processing: Apache Spark




What We’re Looking For:

• 🎯 Skills: Python, TensorFlow, Pytorch, AWS, GCP, Azure

• 💼 Experience: Startup/Scale-up or Corporate experience with exposure to financial services/life sciences

• 🌐 Languages: German/French speaking is a plus

• ❤️ Culture Fit: Passion for ML and a strong culture fit

Title: ML Engineer/Python Developer
Description:
The Life Science Career Network

CTC are specialised industry experts who can help companies source the best talent and provide reliable HR and consulting services, support varied candidates in finding promising career opportunities and offer the latest in skill development training programmes.

Our client is a pioneer in drug discovery and development and a leader in personalized healthcare. As the world’s largest R&D spender in the pharmaceutical and diagnostics domain, they operate in numerous drug discovery and therapeutic areas and are highly recognized internationally.

For their headquarters in Basel, we are currently looking for a Python Developer and a Machine Learning (ML) Engineer on a 6-month contract, with the possibility of extension.

About The Role

We are seeking two highly skilled professionals to join an innovative project that aims to integrate open-source multi-agent systems into a comprehensive, unbiased ranking framework for new drug target proposals.

Responsibilities


Provide agile software development services in line with the project plan
Offer technical consulting services to support the project team
Design and implement RESTful APIs
Utilize Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment processes using GitLab, GitOps, and Kubernetes for hosting services
Integrate selected open-source multi-agent systems towards a ranking framework for drug target proposals
(Optional) Assist with the implementation of user interfaces
(Optional) Work within high-performance computing environments


Required Qualifications


Educational background: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Approximately 5 years of professional experience in a similar role
Proficiency in Python with a solid understanding of software development principles and best practices
Deep knowledge and experience in designing and implementing RESTful APIs
Experience with CI/CD processes using GitLab, GitOps, and Kubernetes


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in machine learning engineering or MLOps, especially within the life sciences domain
Knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs) and LLM-based multi-agent frameworks from an engineering perspective (required for ML Engineer)
Experience working in HPC environments
Familiarity with implementing user interfaces


Would you like to learn more about CTC and the opportunity outlined? Please, get in contact with us: you may either use the 'apply now' button, or write an email to us, or reach out to vanessa.gilardoni@ctcresourcing.com

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir bauen ein multidisziplinäres Team auf, um unser Geschäft mit der Vernetzung und intelligenten Steuerung dezentraler Flexibilitäten auszubauen. Wir suchen einen Data Scientist, der mithilft die Entwicklung dieses Geschäftsbereichs voranzutreiben.




Pensum: 80-100%




Dein zukünftiger Alltag




Du erarbeitest Dir ein vertieftes Know-How in der Energiewirtschaft mit Fokus auf den Flexpooling Bereich, um die Hauptaufgaben der Stelle ausführen zu können
Du beschaffst und strukturierst Daten durch die Verknüpfung unterschiedlicher Datenquellen innerhalb und ausserhalb der CKW (v.a. via API)
Du entwickelst Tools und Algorithmen zur Analyse und Weiterverarbeitung der verschiedenen Daten, inkl. Modelle zur automatisierten Fehlererkennung, Datenbereinigung und Ersatzwertbildung
Du analysierst Daten, inkl. der Interpretation und visuellen Aufbereitung der Ergebnisse (u.a. in Power BI)
Du erstellst Prognosen, inkl. (Weiter-)Entwicklung der Prognosemodelle und teilst diese sowie die bereinigten Quelldaten, Deine Analysen und Prognosen mit Datenanwendern und weiteren Stakeholdern




Was du mitbringst




Abgeschlossenes Studium auf Stufe FH oder Uni im Bereich Naturwissenschaft oder Technik, idealerweise mit quantitativen Methoden sowie Datenbank- und Programmierkenntnisse als Studieninhalt
Hohe Datenaffinität und Begeisterung im Umgang mit Zahlen und Analysen sowie mit energiewirtschaftlichen Fragestellungen
Freude an der Entwicklung von neuen Themen und der Zusammenarbeit mit einem multidisziplinären Team
Methodisches Wissen und Praxiserfahrung in den Bereichen Data Science (Machine Learning), Big Data Technologien, Data Engineering & Modellierung, Datenvisualisierung, Zeitreihenanalyse, Statistische Analyse- und Prognoseverfahren, API-Anbindung, Agile Arbeitsmethoden (z.B. Scrum, Kanban) wünschenswert
Erfahrung in den Bereichen Energie(wirtschaft) und Flexpooling bzw. mit Energiemanagementsysteme wünschenswert
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse, weitere Sprachen sind ein Plus
Show more

Title: AI Researcher (LLM) - (100% remote)
Description:
At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

The role involves building AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops.

Our dynamic team operates entirely remotely, uniting talent from every corner of the globe. Our journey has been marked by rapid growth and efficient operations, firmly establishing us as pioneers within the industry. Join us in building AI models and solutions that not only compete with but exceed the capabilities of current leaders, driving both technological advancement and broad accessibility.

What You'll Do:


Research and Development of multimodal AI models that set new industry standards.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure our AI models are effectively integrated into market-driven solutions.
A degree in Computer Science. Ideally PhD in NLP, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D(with good publications in A* conferences).
Experience building a LLM or other large models from scratch including writing model code, gathering training data, optimizing training and inference.
Strong experience in NLP, multimodal learning, proficient in TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
Excellent programming skills in Python.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist - R Programmer - 5967 URA
Description:
SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST R PROGRAMMER – 5967 URA

Our client, an innovative and dynamic bio-pharmaceutical company headquartered in Switzerland, covering multiple therapeutic areas, committed into delivering products on the market over the next 5 years, is looking a SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST R- Programmer for a 12 months contract (extendable) based in Basel.




Main Responsibilities:

Support statistics, programming and data management groups across Biometry to explore, review, understand and explain clinical data.
Oversee the creation of customized applications to allow dynamic exploration of clinical trial data and results at critical study milestones (especially following major database locks).
Use and promote reproducible research methods to ensure reports may be refreshed efficiently as data is updated.
Communicate results and educate others through insightful visualizations, reports, publications and presentations.
Create outputs that may be used for publication, regulatory submissions, internal decision-making, market tracking, or other uses.
Support statisticians with ad-hoc exploratory analyses following key database locks.
Champion new ways of working with and presenting clinical data and develop educational material to lead the adoption of these methods across Biometry.
Support data-monitoring initiatives including risk-based monitoring by preparing & sharing outputs /reports to Clinical Trial Teams.
Utilize a diverse array of data mining, analytics and modeling techniques to generate and test working hypotheses, deliver insights and support actionable recommendations to Clinical Teams.
Proactively search for trends in clinical data of ongoing studies, including deviations from assumptions.
Lead development of in-house R packages.
Monitor trends in usage of new technologies across the industry with a critical eye.
Contribute/review new standards, policies, templates and procedures.
Ensure processes are followed as defined in quality documents.
Ensure standards for documents, metadata and data are created, maintained and applied.




Qualifications and Experience:

Relevant Swiss working/residency permit and/or Swiss/EU-Citizenship required;
Master’s degree in the field of computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics, with at least 5 years of relevant programming experience, of which at least 3 within a pharmaceutical company or a clinical research organization (CRO).
Experience extracting, cleaning, preparing, modeling and visualizing data; advanced knowledge of one or more statistical programming languages such as R, SAS, Python, Julia;
Advanced knowledge of R packages such as dplyr for data manipulation and ggplot2 for plotting.
Familiar with generation of interactive reports/dashboards, e.g., R Shiny, Dash, Spotfire, Tableau, QlikSense.
Extensive experience with creating reproducible reports through code versioning using RMarkdown or Notebooks.
Excellent knowledge of processes related to statistical analyses in clinical trials.
Knowledge and understanding of CDISC, especially SDTM and ADaM.
Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, ability to manage/prioritize multiple projects.
Entrepreneurial mindset and self-direction, ability to spot trends, teach others and willingness to learn new techniques.
Must be able to work according to operating procedures, specifications and timelines.
Knowledge of international clinical research regulations and requirements (ICH-GCP) and 21 CFR Part 11.
Excellent presentation, interpersonal skills, and a positive communication style.

Show more

SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST R PROGRAMMER – 5967 URA

Our client, an innovative and dynamic bio-pharmaceutical company headquartered in Switzerland, covering multiple therapeutic areas, committed into delivering products on the market over the next 5 years, is looking a SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST R- Programmer for a 12 months contract (extendable) based in Basel.


Main Responsibilities:

  • Support statistics, programming and data management groups across Biometry to explore, review, understand and explain clinical data.
  • Oversee the creation of customized applications to allow dynamic exploration of clinical trial data and results at critical study milestones (especially following major database locks).
  • Use and promote reproducible research methods to ensure reports may be refreshed efficiently as data is updated.
  • Communicate results and educate others through insightful visualizations, reports, publications and presentations.
  • Create outputs that may be used for publication, regulatory submissions, internal decision-making, market tracking, or other uses.
  • Support statisticians with ad-hoc exploratory analyses following key database locks.
  • Champion new ways of working with and presenting clinical data and develop educational material to lead the adoption of these methods across Biometry.
  • Support data-monitoring initiatives including risk-based monitoring by preparing & sharing outputs /reports to Clinical Trial Teams.
  • Utilize a diverse array of data mining, analytics and modeling techniques to generate and test working hypotheses, deliver insights and support actionable recommendations to Clinical Teams.
  • Proactively search for trends in clinical data of ongoing studies, including deviations from assumptions.
  • Lead development of in-house R packages.
  • Monitor trends in usage of new technologies across the industry with a critical eye.
  • Contribute/review new standards, policies, templates and procedures.
  • Ensure processes are followed as defined in quality documents.
  • Ensure standards for documents, metadata and data are created, maintained and applied.


Qualifications and Experience:

  • Relevant Swiss working/residency permit and/or Swiss/EU-Citizenship required;
  • Master’s degree in the field of computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics, with at least 5 years of relevant programming experience, of which at least 3 within a pharmaceutical company or a clinical research organization (CRO).
  • Experience extracting, cleaning, preparing, modeling and visualizing data; advanced knowledge of one or more statistical programming languages such as R, SAS, Python, Julia;
  • Advanced knowledge of R packages such as dplyr for data manipulation and ggplot2 for plotting.
  • Familiar with generation of interactive reports/dashboards, e.g., R Shiny, Dash, Spotfire, Tableau, QlikSense.
  • Extensive experience with creating reproducible reports through code versioning using RMarkdown or Notebooks.
  • Excellent knowledge of processes related to statistical analyses in clinical trials.
  • Knowledge and understanding of CDISC, especially SDTM and ADaM.
  • Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, ability to manage/prioritize multiple projects.
  • Entrepreneurial mindset and self-direction, ability to spot trends, teach others and willingness to learn new techniques.
  • Must be able to work according to operating procedures, specifications and timelines.
  • Knowledge of international clinical research regulations and requirements (ICH-GCP) and 21 CFR Part 11.
  • Excellent presentation, interpersonal skills, and a positive communication style.

Title: Artificial Intelligence, Data Science Software Engineer 100% (m/w/d)
Description:
Was ist meine Funktion?


Ausarbeitung von Konzepten für geplante Features in den Bereichen KI und Data Science
Entwurf, Entwicklung und Wartung von Anwendungen mit Python und C# unter Berücksichtigung von KI- und Machine Learning-Komponenten, wie z.B. Analyseanwendungen unter Verwendung LLM, APIs und Vektordatenbanken
Durchführen von Machbarkeitsstudien zur Erstellung, Analyse und Implementierung innovativer Algorithmen für komplexe Problemstellungen
Proaktives und kontinuierliches Verfolgen der neuesten Trends, Technologien und Best Practices in den Bereichen KI, Data Science und Machine Learning


Was brauche ich, um erfolgreich zu sein?


Hochschulausbildung in Informatik, Künstlicher Intelligenz oder Mathematik mit Schwerpunkt auf Machine Learning (Masterstudium Uni / ETH)
Ausgezeichnete Problemlösungsfähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, eigenständig und im Team zu arbeiten.
Gutes konkretes und abstraktes Verständnis für Anwender-Anforderungen
Selbständige und zielorientierte Arbeitsweise und resultatorientierte Denkweise
Hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein in der Konzeption wie auch in der Implementierung


Was sind meine Vorteile?


flexible Arbeitszeiten, Jahresarbeitszeit und Sabbaticals.
einen top modernen Arbeitsplatz.
wertvolle Weiterbildungsangebote und gleichwertige Modelle für die Fach- und Führungskarriere.


Was zeichnet das Unternehmen aus?

Unser Kunde ist Qualitätsführer in der Geschäftsautomation für kleine und mittelgrosse Unternehmen und Organisationen.

Deutsch: C2 - Muttersprachliches Niveau

Title: Data Scientist (6033)
Description:
The Life Science Career Network

CTC are specialised industry experts who help companies source the best talent and provide reliable HR and consulting services. We support candidates in finding promising career opportunities and offer the latest in skill development training programs.

Our client is a leading global player in the pharmaceutical industry with headquarters in Basel, Switzerland. They focus on novel therapies in Oncology and Ophthalmology, and are developing a world-leading pipeline in Neuroscience and Dermatology, boasting one of the strongest Phase II/III pipelines globally.

Data Scientist (6-month contract)

About The Role

The Data Scientist will work with quantitative scientists, domain experts, and product developers to ensure teams succeed in answering scientific questions using the client's platform. They will apply and develop analytical methods and predictive models that impact research and drug development programs, and collaborate on analytical pipelines that can be reused across the platform. They will also advocate for good data science practices and contribute to the design of the platform, making it accessible and useful for the data science and AI community.

Key Responsibilities


Enable and support scientific teams to achieve their goals using the client's platform.
Accelerate data science through the development of reusable pipelines for data preparation and analysis.
Develop frameworks for generating and reporting key results, quality benchmarks for data, models, and impact in collaboration with data scientist users.
Apply expertise in machine learning, deep learning, data visualization, and structured/unstructured data analytics to achieve scientific goals.
Advocate for good data science practices.


Requirements


At least 2 years of professional experience in the pharmaceutical sector.
Experience with bioinformatics (DNA/RNA/proteomics data analysis), statistical genetics, and/or biostatistics.
Strong experience with R or Python for data analysis and statistical modeling.
Experience using machine learning models to predict clinical endpoints using multimodal data.
Experience with AI/GenAI/LLMs for automating or accelerating data science-related processes.
Familiarity with principles and tools of good data science practices (e.g., Git/versioning).
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.


Desirable Additional Skills


Knowledge of CDISC data standards (SDTM, ADaM).
Experience with pooling clinical trial data.
Understanding of the drug discovery and development process.
Experience in Immunology or Cardiology/Renal/Metabolic diseases.
Experience with computational environments for large-scale data science (e.g., high-performance computing or Spark).
Statistical and machine learning, and/or applied deep learning methods for time series data.
Experience using the Foundry platform for data analysis.


Would you like to learn more about CTC and this opportunity? Please contact us by using the 'apply now' button or write an email to vanessa.gilardoni@ctcresourcing.com

Title: Data Scientist - Pharma, bioinformatics
Description:
Data Scientist requiring profound Pharma and Bioinformatics knowledge vacancy for a globally operating Basel based company in the pharmaceutical sector.

Your tasks:

Supporting scientific teams in achieving their goals
Developing reusable pipelines for data preparation and analyses
Creating frameworks for generating key results and quality benchmarks
Appling machine learning and deep learning expertise to scientific objectives
Advocating for good data science practices


Your experience/knowledge:

2+ years of experience in the pharmaceutical sector
Expertise in omics data analysis, Immunology, Cardiology, Renal, Metabolic diseases, or large-scale data computation
Proficiency in R or Python for data analysis and statistical modeling
Experience with machine learning models for predicting clinical endpoints
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
PhD in a quantitative or computational science such as bioinformatics, machine learning or statistics


Location: Basel, Switzerland
Work setting: On-site
Sector: Pharma
Start: ASAP
Duration: 05MM+
Workload: 100%
Ref.Nr.: BH21925

Take the next step and send us your resume along with a daytime phone number where we can reach you.
Due to Swiss work permit restrictions, we can only consider applications from Swiss nationals, EU citizens as well as current work-permit holders for Switzerland.
Ukrainian refugees are warmly welcomed, we will support you all the way.
We welcome applications from individuals of all genders, age groups, sexual orientations, personal expressions, ethnic backgrounds, and religious beliefs. Therefore, there is no requirement to provide gender information or a photo in your application.

As per client requirements, we need information about your marital status, nationality, date of birth, and a valid Swiss work permit. For applicants with disabilities, we are happy to explore potential solutions with our end client.

Title: Data Science Internship (6 months)
Description:
CT_Technology & Innovation-E122

Data Science Internship (6 months) - Full Time - Oberwinterthur, Switzerland

Sulzer is a leading engineering company with a proud heritage of innovation. Join our global team to grow your expertise and develop innovative solutions that enable a prosperous and more sustainable society.

We are looking for a Data Science Trainee for 6 months to join our Technology and Innovation team in the Research and Development function in Oberwinterthur, Switzerland.

You will be part of our R&D organization and experience the development of new products from the ideation phase to market-ready products for our Separation Technology business unit. The focus for this position will be on our digitalization initiative. You will work with a dynamic and innovative team to support data-driven product development.

Your main tasks and responsibilities:


Building workflows to capture and structure data from our pilot plants and production facilities.
Statistical and machine-learning-assisted analyses of the data to identify critical parameters and optimize product development.
Implement new analytical technologies to further enhance our digitalization efforts.


To succeed in this role, you will need:


We look for excellent students in Chemical, Process or Mechanical Engineering (or related fields).
Strong data science experience in areas including statistical modeling, data mining, data visualization and data-driven analyses.
Proficiency in a programming language such as Python or R.
Knowledge of databases and data pipelines.
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office is expected.
Ability to co-ordinate and prioritize various tasks.
Driven, innovative and curious mindset.


What we offer you:


25 days holiday (inclusive of bank holidays) + service days
Defined contribution pension scheme
Employee Assistance Program/health care
On-site car parking/public transport allowance
Access to a wide range of discounts


No visa or work permit support can be provided for this role.

To complete your application, we kindly ask you to include your CV and other supporting documentation, such as academic transcripts, and, if available, written references.

Sulzer is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and are committed to offering an inclusive work environment.

We are proud to be recognized as a Top Employer 2024 in Brazil, China, Germany, Switzerland, the United Kingdom and the United States.

Title: Software Engineer, Machine Learning, Gemini
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, or 1 year of experience with an advanced degree.
2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms.
2 years of experience with machine learning algorithms and tools (e.g., TensorFlow), artificial intelligence, deep learning, or natural language processing.


Preferred qualifications:


PhD in Machine Learning or a related field.
Experience with Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT) and Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF).
Experience working with Large Language Models (LLMs).
Ability to grow under pressure in high-stakes, high-visibility environments.
Excellent data analysis skills.


About The Job

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

The team is working on all Multimodal efforts across Gemini. We launched image retrieval, image understanding and generation. This includes a significant amount of deep modeling such as Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT), Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF), and iterative process optimization (IPO) establishing data flywheel, etc. Part of the team is also involved in building necessary infrastructure and landing multimodal model capabilities and features.

In this role, you will have significant external impact, offering tremendous potential for growth and increased responsibility.

A conversational AI tool that enables users to collaborate with generative AI and help augment their imagination, expand their curiosity, and enhance their productivity.

Responsibilities


Collaborate with Research teams to understand technologies, adapting and integrating them into Gemini/Bard to drive continuous improvement.
Leverage Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT), Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF), and Preference Optimization (IPO) to quality hill climb.
Conduct in-depth data analysis to uncover insights, pinpoint opportunities, and inform the strategic development of a data flywheel.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
