Title: Machine Learning Engineer (m/w/d) (80-100%)
Description:
At Accelleron, we go further. Building on the heritage of more than 100 years as ABB Turbocharging, you will join a team of true experts in an exciting international environment that share a commitment to excel, to be a trusted partner in supporting our customers in the gradual change towards sustainable industries with innovative technology, expertise and smart solutions. We are driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions as we welcome and celebrate individual differences.







Job description

Within the Digital Division of Accelleron, we are seeking a talented Machine Learning Engineer to join our newly formed AI team and contribute to the development of AI/ML-driven initiatives. As ML Engineer, you will play a crucial role in setting up and maintaining cloud infrastructure to facilitate model training, deployment, and lifecycle management. Your duties will involve a combination of hands-on coding, infrastructure setup, and collaboration with data scientists to support the development of cutting-edge machine learning solutions for use in our digital customer solutions and business services.




We are open for international applications with possibility to be hired in country you’re based in!







Your responsibilities:

Work closely with, and support data scientists in bringing blue-print models to production by writing clean and maintainable Python code, leveraging frameworks such as PyTorch, Tensorflow, etc.
Spearhead the integration of pioneering neural network architectures into value-adding machine learning projects, fostering a culture of innovation within the team and continually pushing the boundaries of model performance and capability.
Ensure proper model deployment and lifecycle on our Azure infrastructure, setting up and managing cloud resources as necessary to ensure scalability and robustness.
Collaborate closely with both business stakeholders and experts on turbocharging to translate project requirements into value-adding machine learning solutions.







Your background:

Proven experience (3+ years) working as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role in a professional setting.
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field.
Solid understanding of cloud computing concepts and experience with cloud platforms, preferably Azure.
Proficiency in Python programming language and experience with machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch and TensorFlow.
Experience in SQL.
Strong knowledge of software development best practices including version control, code reviews, and automated testing.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
Effective communication skills with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.










Your benefits:

Attractive compensation & benefits
Employee Assistance Program
Remote Work Policy
Global parental leave program
Flexible working models







We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about Accelleron, take another look at our website accelleron-industries.com.




Accelleron Data Privacy Statement: accelleron-industries.com/privacy-notice/candidate

Title: Machine Learning (Networking Systems)
Description:
We are currently working with an industry leading consumer technology brand in Zurich to find them a Machine Learning Researcher for Networking Systems.




Responsibilities:

• Conduct innovative research in using Machine Learning to enhance Networking Systems

• Design, develop, and evaluate machine learning algorithms to optimize Network Performance.

• Innovate and develop new technologies in ML for Network Technologies

• Produce and present research papers at top-tier conferences.

• Mentor and guide junior researchers and interns.




Requirements:

• PhD or MSc in a relevant field.

• A background in Computer Architecture.

• Proven track record of publishing research papers in prestigious conferences.

• Proficiency in Python, Tensorflow and PyTorch.

• Research experience in one or more of the following: workload characterization, DNNs, LLMs, Memory Sub-System Arrangement, Network Architecture, High Performance Computing Architecture.




Salary: Negotiable, based on experience.

Location: Zurich, Switzerland

Fully on-site.




Email scot@microtech-global.com for more information

Show more
HTML:
We are currently working with an industry leading consumer technology brand in Zurich to find them a Machine Learning Researcher for Networking Systems.


Responsibilities:

• Conduct innovative research in using Machine Learning to enhance Networking Systems

• Design, develop, and evaluate machine learning algorithms to optimize Network Performance.

• Innovate and develop new technologies in ML for Network Technologies

• Produce and present research papers at top-tier conferences.

• Mentor and guide junior researchers and interns.


Requirements:

• PhD or MSc in a relevant field.

• A background in Computer Architecture.

• Proven track record of publishing research papers in prestigious conferences.

• Proficiency in Python, Tensorflow and PyTorch.

• Research experience in one or more of the following: workload characterization, DNNs, LLMs, Memory Sub-System Arrangement, Network Architecture, High Performance Computing Architecture.


Salary: Negotiable, based on experience.

Location: Zurich, Switzerland

Fully on-site.


Email scot@microtech-global.com for more information

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Expleo propose une offre unique de services intégrés d'ingénierie, qualité et conseil stratégique pour la transformation digitale. Dans un contexte d'accélération technologique sans précédent, nous sommes le partenaire de confiance des entreprises qui innovent. Nous les aidons à développer un avantage compétitif et à améliorer le quotidien de millions de personnes.

Intégrer Expleo Switzerland, C’est 19 000 Collaborateurs, Dans 32 Pays, Avec €1.5Md De CA En 2023, Mais Également


Avoir un accompagnement technique et humain à chaque projet et un suivi performant de votre carrière
Réaliser des formations pour développer ses capacités professionnelles
Participer à des événements spéciaux dédiés
Intégrer une équipe dynamique


Data Scientist (HF)

Afin d’accompagner notre croissance en Suisse, nous recherchons un Data Scientist (H/F) dont la mission principale sera d'accompagner le domaine métier « Industrialisation » d’un de nos clients dans le secteur de l’horlogerie,

Mission


Accompagner le département industrialisation dans la construction de la vision stratégique des outils de data science
Elaborer des solutions de data science permettant de répondre aux besoins métier.
Identifier et formaliser le besoin en collaboration avec le métier et animer des ateliers.
Formuler les cahiers des charges des modèles de Machine Learning (ML).
Promouvoir les bonnes pratiques d’industrialisation des solutions de Data Science.
Mettre au point les prototypes Data Science et démontrer la valeur des solutions élaborées.
Concevoir et exécuter les tests nécessaires à la mise en production des livrables Data Science.
Permettre l’industrialisation des solutions prototypées en collaboration avec l'IT.
Collaborer à l’élaboration des interfaces permettant une utilisation élargie des modèles de Data Science.
Accompagner le métier dans l'optique d'évoluer vers une "data driven company".


Profil


Bachelor/Master en Ingénierie industrielle complétée par un Master en Data Science.
Expérience en milieu industriel et expérience démontrée de 5 ans en Data Science.
Pratique avérée de la Business analyse.
Connaissances nécessaires de Python, Machine Learning, Dataiku.
Leadership, autonomie, rigueur, proactivité.
Capacité à proposer et challenger les positions établies.
Aisance dans la communication avec tous types d'interlocuteurs, sens relationnel, goût pour le travail en équipe.


Seules les candidatures des citoyens suisses et de l'UE seront prises en compte / Nos postes sont accessibles aux personnes en situation de handicap / Télétravail possible

Title: Machine Learning Engineer / Trader (H/F) 80-100%
Description:
Description du poste :

 

Actif·ve·s en Suisse occidentale, nous aidons nos client·e·s à réaliser leurs projets en fournissant des solutions énergétiques globales, efficaces et durables, qu’il s’agisse de production et de distribution d’électricité et de chaleur, d’installations électriques, de domotique, de mobilité douce, de climatisation ou de traitement de l’eau. Employeur exemplaire, nous soutenons le développement des compétences de nos 2700 collaborateurs·trice·s, dont 260 apprenti·e·s, ainsi que la conciliation entre vie privée et professionnelle.

La Direction Energie électrique exploite les infrastructures de production hydrauliques et thermiques, développe des installations de production à partir d’énergies renouvelables et assure un approvisionnement en électricité aux meilleures conditions. 

Afin de compléter notre équipe, nous sommes à la recherche de notre futur·e :

 

Machine Learning Engineer / Trader (H/F) 80-100%

 

Mission : 

Développer des algorithmes et modèles prédictifs s’intégrant dans l’activités de gestion de portefeuilles (times series, machine learning, data engineering, …) 
Optimiser financièrement, définir et réaliser des stratégies de couverture des portefeuilles de production et de consommation sur les marchés de l’électricité
Valoriser les ouvrages de production et saisir les opportunités avec toutes les options de valorisation de la flexibilité
Concevoir des outils d’étude statistiques et pouvoir présenter les résultats de manière efficace 

 

Profil :

Formation technique supérieure (EPF/HES/UNI), idéalement dans le domaine de la data science 
Expérience dans le « machine learning », idéalement dans les time series
Connaissance de l’écosystème Linux, Docker et GIT
Maîtrise d’un ou plusieurs langages de programmation, particulièrement pour Python (Pandas) et SQL
Compétences avancées en mathématiques, statistiques, probabilités et connaissances des systèmes stochastiques
Idéalement, connaissances du marché de l’énergie, des installations hydrauliques et des prévisions météorologiques.
Prêt à vous engager, orienté marché et négoce, résistant au stress (possibilité de travailler jusqu'à 20% en télétravail)
Service de piquet sur appel 24/24 depuis votre domicile (toutes les 6 semaines)

Ce que nous vous offrons : 

Un environnement évolutif et favorable à l’équilibre entre la vie professionnelle et privée.
Les prestations sociales d’une entreprise moderne, une équité de traitement, des possibilités de développement professionnel.
Un fort esprit de cohésion et une équipe fière de collaborer : « Ensemble, nous avançons vers la réussite ».

 

Besoin de renseignements complémentaires ?Contactez Alain Berset, Responsable Gestion court terme au 079 518 62 00.

 

Ressources Humaines

Brice Muller

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you looking for an R&D environment where you can work with world-class scientists and engineers on cutting edge projects? Do you want to contribute to a better world while building a career? Do you also have a passion for science, engineering, technology, business, data and human creativity?

You will be part of a diverse and inclusive team of Data Scientists and Engineers working on solving interesting, real-world problems that truly make a difference. Your main responsibilities will be to deliver value for clients in the Nordics. Supported by our global knowledge base and network of skilled colleagues, you will be part of strategic discussions and contribute to solutioning.

Requirements For The Role


Masters or PhD in a scientific field (computer science, mathematics, biology, engineering etc.)
A minimum of 5 years of relevant academic or professional experience within data engineering and data science
An analytical mindset, a willingness to roll up your sleeves and solve hands-on technical challenges
Excellent communication and presentation skills and an ability to explain complex concepts
Experience in one or several object-oriented scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
Knowledge of cloud platforms, tools and services provided by AWS, Azure or Google Cloud
Understanding how to implement effective ETL steps on said platforms
Excellent English communication skills, both verbally and written
Be an EU citizen or hold a work permit


Meritorious Skills


5+ years of professional experience
Business analysis and tech project management skills are an advantage
Working knowledge of databases, SQL and/or Elasticsearch, and experience with data management tools such as Databricks.
Experience implementing data pipelines using tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, Knime (or similar)


What We Offer

Capgemini Engineering is one of the world's leading consulting companies in R&D. We work in most industries globally. We deliver, together with our global centers of expertise, solutions for both large global customers and smaller local start-up companies.

We offer you a work environment branded by innovation. You will be working with the cutting edge of IT and technology, surrounded by dedicated and skilled colleagues with high expertise.

As a consultant at Capgemini Engineering, you will belong in a global professional community with well formed career paths, trainings and opportunities for mentorship and continuous competence development opportunities.

Join us and Get The Future You Want!

Welcome with your application!
Show more

3+ years of experience with cloud-based platform, ideally Microsoft Azure

Title: (Junior) Cloud Engineer (a) 60-100%
Description:
Suchst du viel Handlungsspielraum, ein wertschätzendes Umfeld, neue Technologien sowie eine fördernde Unternehmenskultur? Unsere Kundin, ein IT-Dienstleistungsunternehmen mit mehreren Standorten in der Deutschschweiz, sucht zur Verstärkung ihres Teams mehrere (Junior) Cloud Engineers (a). Das Unternehmen ist seit mehr als 25 Jahren einer der führenden Softwarehersteller von CRM-Software und hat heute über 300 Mitarbeitende.




Deine Herausforderung

In deiner neuen Rolle als Junior Cloud Engineer entwickelst du gemeinsam im Team die Multi-Cloud Betriebsplattform. Du stellst den Betrieb der Cloud-Plattform sicher, realisierst kundenspezifische Projekte und entwickelst die SaaS-Lösungen weiter. Dabei bringst du deine bisherigen Fachkenntnisse sowie Erfahrungen gekonnt ein und setzt dich aktiv mit neuen Technologien auseinander.




Deine Qualitäten und Begabungen

Abgeschlossenes Technisches Studium (FH, Uni oder ETH)
Erste Berührungspunkte mit Cloud-Technologien
Grundlagenkenntnisse oder starkes Interesse an: Bash, Python, Docker, Kubernetes, Softwareautomatisierung, Linux etc.
Du arbeitest gerne im Team und dein unternehmerisches Denken zeichnet dich aus
Deutsch ist deine Muttersprache und du hast sehr gute Englischkenntnisse




Spannende Projekte, vielfältige Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten, flache Hierarchien und flexible Arbeitszeiten erwarten dich! Bist du interessiert?

Dann freut sich Lorena Alessandri auf deine Bewerbungsunterlagen oder auf deinen Anruf.




Lorena Alessandri

Niederlassungsleiterin

Telefon: +41 41 417 10 00

lorena.alessandri@consultandpepper.com

Title: Software Engineer III, AI/ML
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, or 1 year of experience with an advanced degree.
2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms.
Experience in coding and Machine Learning (ML).
Experience in Computer Vision.


Preferred qualifications:


Experience with software development in C++.


About The Job

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

Responsibilities


Write product or system development code.
Improve the signals and understand the query of Google Lens.
Develop and evaluate image embedding of lens quality.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Test Engineer / Software Tester
Description:
Test Engineer / Software Tester

Experis ist ein weltweit führender Anbieter von personalisierten Rekrutierungslösungen und Fachkräften im IT-Bereich.

Wir suchen dich! Einen erfahrenen Test Engineer zur Verstärkung des Teams unseres Kunden.

Start: 01.09.2024 oder nach Vereinbarung

Vertragsart: 12 Monate (mit Option auf Verlängerung)

Ort: Bern

Arbeitsmodel: Hybrid (Homeoffice nach Vereinbarung)

Pensum: 80% - 100% bei 40 Stunden pro Woche

Sprache: Deutsch C2, Englisch C1

Als Teil unseres Teams übernehmen Sie Verantwortung für die Durchführung und Dokumentation von Tests gemäß festgelegten Richtlinien und Standards.

Deine Aufgaben

Überprüfen der Testbarkeit von Benutzersystemen und Bewertungen
Validierung von Testkonzepten und -modellen
Analyse von Produkt-Risiken und Testumgebungen
Implementierung und Überwachung von Teststrategien und -werkzeugen
Ausführung, Überprüfung und Dokumentation von Testfällen
Fehleranalyse und -behebung sowie Leistungsüberprüfung von Testsystemen

Damit kannst du Punkten

Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Informatik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Testmethoden, -werkzeugen und -prozessen
Erfahrung in der Durchführung und Dokumentation von Tests
Teamfähigkeit, Kommunikationsstärke und selbstständige Arbeitsweise
Idealerweise Erfahrung mit Testautomatisierung und agilen Methoden

Aufgrund der Beschränkungen der Schweizer Arbeitsbewilligung können wir nur Bewerbungen von Schweizer Staatsangehörigen, EU-Bürgern oder Inhabern einer aktuellen Arbeitsbewilligung für die Schweiz berücksichtigen.

Unser Kunde bietet dir die Möglichkeit, in einem spannenden und zukunftsorientierten Umfeld zu arbeiten und deine Fähigkeiten kontinuierlich weiterzuentwickeln. Wenn du dich angesprochen fühlst und die erforderlichen Qualifikationen mitbringst, freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung.

LinkedIn: Wladislaw Braun

Tel.: +41 44 229 99 17

HTML:
Test Engineer / Software Tester

Experis ist ein weltweit führender Anbieter von personalisierten Rekrutierungslösungen und Fachkräften im IT-Bereich.

Wir suchen dich! Einen erfahrenen Test Engineer zur Verstärkung des Teams unseres Kunden.

Start: 01.09.2024 oder nach Vereinbarung

Vertragsart: 12 Monate (mit Option auf Verlängerung)

Ort: Bern

Arbeitsmodel: Hybrid (Homeoffice nach Vereinbarung)

Pensum: 80% - 100% bei 40 Stunden pro Woche

Sprache: Deutsch C2, Englisch C1

Als Teil unseres Teams übernehmen Sie Verantwortung für die Durchführung und Dokumentation von Tests gemäß festgelegten Richtlinien und Standards.

Deine Aufgaben

  • Überprüfen der Testbarkeit von Benutzersystemen und Bewertungen
  • Validierung von Testkonzepten und -modellen
  • Analyse von Produkt-Risiken und Testumgebungen
  • Implementierung und Überwachung von Teststrategien und -werkzeugen
  • Ausführung, Überprüfung und Dokumentation von Testfällen
  • Fehleranalyse und -behebung sowie Leistungsüberprüfung von Testsystemen

Damit kannst du Punkten

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Informatik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation
  • Fundierte Kenntnisse in Testmethoden, -werkzeugen und -prozessen
  • Erfahrung in der Durchführung und Dokumentation von Tests
  • Teamfähigkeit, Kommunikationsstärke und selbstständige Arbeitsweise
  • Idealerweise Erfahrung mit Testautomatisierung und agilen Methoden

Aufgrund der Beschränkungen der Schweizer Arbeitsbewilligung können wir nur Bewerbungen von Schweizer Staatsangehörigen, EU-Bürgern oder Inhabern einer aktuellen Arbeitsbewilligung für die Schweiz berücksichtigen.

Unser Kunde bietet dir die Möglichkeit, in einem spannenden und zukunftsorientierten Umfeld zu arbeiten und deine Fähigkeiten kontinuierlich weiterzuentwickeln. Wenn du dich angesprochen fühlst und die erforderlichen Qualifikationen mitbringst, freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung.

Title: Data Scientist - Pharma, bioinformatics
Description:
Data Scientist requiring profound Pharma and Bioinformatics knowledge vacancy for a globally operating Basel based company in the pharmaceutical sector.

Your Tasks


Supporting scientific teams in achieving their goals
Developing reusable pipelines for data preparation and analyses
Creating frameworks for generating key results and quality benchmarks
Appling machine learning and deep learning expertise to scientific objectives
Advocating for good data science practices


Your Experience/knowledge


2+ years of experience in the pharmaceutical sector
Expertise in omics data analysis, Immunology, Cardiology, Renal, Metabolic diseases, or large-scale data computation
Proficiency in R or Python for data analysis and statistical modelling
Experience with machine learning models for predicting clinical endpoints
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
PhD in a quantitative or computational science such as bioinformatics, machine learning or statistics


Location: Basel, Switzerland

Work setting: On-site

Sector: Pharma

Start: ASAP

Duration: 05MM+

Workload: 100%

Ref.Nr.: BH21925

Take the next step and send us your resume along with a daytime phone number where we can reach you.

Due to Swiss work permit restrictions, we can only consider applications from Swiss nationals, EU citizens as well as current work-permit holders for Switzerland.

Ukrainian refugees are warmly welcomed, we will support you all the way.

We welcome applications from individuals of all genders, age groups, sexual orientations, personal expressions, ethnic backgrounds, and religious beliefs. Therefore, there is no requirement to provide gender information or a photo in your application.

As per client requirements, we need information about your marital status, nationality, date of birth, and a valid Swiss work permit. For applicants with disabilities, we are happy to explore potential solutions with our end client.

Title: Data scientist
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

Result of Service

The consultant will contribute to the creation of a new global database measuring the perception and relative incidence of various topics in the media.

Work Location

Home-Based

Expected duration

29.07.24 to 15.03.25

Duties And Responsibilities

This position is located in the Office of the Secretary-General of UNCTAD, in the Technical Team of the Global Crisis Response Group. Under the direct supervision of the lead data scientist and the overall supervision of the Senior Coordinator, and within delegated authority, the consultant will be responsible for: - Supporting and furthering the team's existing date projects; - Researching potential future projects, including, but not limited to: the development and creation of a media perception dataset and index, and the creation of economic indicators from satellite imagery and geospatial data; - Identifying trends and patterns in data on the effects of the global crisis on food, energy and finance on the world economy and particularly developing countries; - Assessing the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques; - Developing custom data models, algorithms, and economic models to apply to data sets of the GCRG, and maintaining comprehensive and well-structured documentation of algorithms, models, and code; - Maintaining and organizing the databases needed or generated by the Technical Team.

Qualifications/special Skills

An advanced university degree (Master or equivalent) in economics, statistics, data science or similar field, is required. At least 6 years experience of working with data analysis, economic modelling, or economic analysis in a professional or academic setting is required. Proficiency in a statistical programming language, preferably R, and a data science programming language, preferably Python is required. Additional experience with SQL, Git, R Markdown and Jupyter Lab is desirable.

Languages

Fluency spoken and written in English is required.

Additional Information

Not available.

No Fee

THE UNITED NATIONS DOES NOT CHARGE A FEE AT ANY STAGE OF THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS (APPLICATION, INTERVIEW MEETING, PROCESSING, OR TRAINING). THE UNITED NATIONS DOES NOT CONCERN ITSELF WITH INFORMATION ON APPLICANTS’ BANK ACCOUNTS.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
JOB PURPOSE

Are you passionate about uncovering insights from data and driving innovative solutions? Do you excel at solving complex problems and developing advanced models? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Scientist to join our dynamic Revenue Management team. In this role, you'll harness your expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning to optimise our revenue strategies.


KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

• Analyse large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for revenue growth.

• Develop and implement predictive models to forecast demand and optimise pricing strategies.

• Apply time series analysis and machine learning theory to improve demand forecasting and inventory management.

• Manage and improve interactive web applications for data visualisation.

• Perform web scraping to gather external data relevant to revenue management.

• Generate actionable insights from data analysis to support decision-making processes.

• Present findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner.

• Review and document code to ensure clarity, maintainability, and best practices.

• Stay current with industry trends and advancements in data science methodologies.


QUALIFICATIONS

• Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.

• Proven experience as a Data Scientist, preferably in the travel, hospitality, or related industries.

• Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and SQL.

• Experience with TensorFlow, Keras, Streamlit, Prophet.

• Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.

• Knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, and time series analysis.

• Excellent communication and presentation skills.

• Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

• Knowledge of web scraping techniques and tools.

• Proven capability to industrialise models and implement solutions into production environments.

• Experience with deploying applications and models using Docker, Jenkins, and other similar tools.

• Strong skills in ETL processes and data architecture.


VISA REQUIREMENTS

EU Passport or Right to work in Switzerland.

Show more

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Our client is a ML focused consultancy who are looking for a talented ML Engineer to join their innovative team. They partner with start-ups and scale-ups to build initial AI components, as well as assisting larger companies in developing their comprehensive ML capabilities. Why Join the team?




• 🌍 Location: Basel office with hybrid working flexibility •

🚀 Start Date: August/September




Role Highlights:

• 💡 Innovate: Identify and capitalize on new business and product opportunities

• 🤖 Inspire: Challenge and inspire the team with state-of-the-art applied ML

• 🛠️ Build: Analyze problems, develop solutions, and ensure successful delivery

• 📊 Develop: Perform preprocessing, feature engineering, and dataset creation

• 🔍 Validate: Develop ML models and validate their results

• 📈 Pipeline: Develop robust data pipelines and infrastructure




Technical Stack:

• 🖥️ Languages & Libraries: Python, Scikit-learn, specialized Python and R ML libraries

• 🧠 Deep Learning: Pytorch, TensorFlow/Keras

• ☁️ Cloud Platforms: GCP, AWS, Azure

• 🗄️ Databases: Relational databases

• ⚙️ Distributed Processing: Apache Spark




What We’re Looking For:

• 🎯 Skills: Python, TensorFlow, Pytorch, AWS, GCP, Azure

• 💼 Experience: Startup/Scale-up or Corporate experience with exposure to financial services/life sciences

• 🌐 Languages: German/French speaking is a plus

• ❤️ Culture Fit: Passion for ML and a strong culture fit

Show more

Title: Senior AI/ML Engineer
Description:
OLSYS provides full-service solutions for mid-market and enterprise organizations.

With 15+ years of experience, 100+ projects, and 50+ strong technical experts in the team, we continue to grow by expanding our development team in Europe, as well as expanding the base of new clients and projects.

As an enterprise software development company, we are building long-term partnerships helping our clients accelerate their digital experiences with reasonable IT investments.

Our tailored approach, e-commerce focus, and flexible solutions allow us to design, develop, and deliver scalable, integrated commerce platforms that drive profits and boost the business.

Our Industry Focus

— Banking and Finance (business continuity management, planning system, banking app development);

— Retail and E-Commerce (B2B Commerce, B2C Commerce, Digital/E-Commerce customer experience);

— Healthcare (website development for Healthcare organizations).

Our Expertise Includes

— Commerce Solutions

— Development Services

— Creative Services

— Quality Assurance and Testing

— Maintenance and Support

— E-Commerce Consulting

The Role

Responsibilities


Interact with the modern LLMs and adopt the best practices of their usage.
R&D activities (experimenting with LLMs): Generate code based on the input description. Build test cases based on the user scenarios.
Performance Monitoring: Monitor the performance of the models and make adjustments as necessary to maintain or enhance model accuracy and efficiency.
Data Preprocessing and Annotation: Work with the Data Engineering team to preprocess and annotate the training data for AI/ML models. Collaborate with subject matter experts to create labeled datasets that facilitate supervised and unsupervised learning.
Prototyping and Evaluation: Rapidly prototype and iterate different AI/ML approaches to identify the most suitable solution to meet the requirements.


Perform rigorous evaluations to measure the model's performance against defined metrics.


Documentation: Document all stages of the AI/ML development process, including design choices, architecture, algorithms, and evaluation results, ensuring knowledge transfer and team understanding.
Collaboration: Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Data Scientists and Software Engineers.
Stay Abreast of Industry Trends: Keep up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI/ML, NLP, LLM and other relevant technologies. Integrate new research findings and methodologies into the project as applicable.


Ideal Profile


Experience: Demonstrated experience of at least 5 years in developing AI/ML solutions with a focus on LLM and LLM frameworks (e.g. LangChain). Strong knowledge and practical experience in Generative AI, Interactive Chatbots, Graph databases.
Data Processing: Experience in preprocessing and handling large-scale, unstructured text data, and the ability to perform data analysis and validation.
Problem-solving and Innovation: Proven ability to tackle complex technical challenges, think innovatively, and propose creative solutions to real-world problems.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


English level: Upper-Intermediate

What's on Offer?


You can contribute and influence the development of a new product
Work with AI product
Flexible working options
Show more

Title: ML Engineer/Python Developer
Description:
The Life Science Career Network

CTC are specialised industry experts who can help companies source the best talent and provide reliable HR and consulting services, support varied candidates in finding promising career opportunities and offer the latest in skill development training programmes.

Our client is a pioneer in drug discovery and development and a leader in personalized healthcare. As the world’s largest R&D spender in the pharmaceutical and diagnostics domain, they operate in numerous drug discovery and therapeutic areas and are highly recognized internationally.

For their headquarters in Basel, we are currently looking for a Python Developer and a Machine Learning (ML) Engineer on a 6-month contract, with the possibility of extension.

About The Role

We are seeking two highly skilled professionals to join an innovative project that aims to integrate open-source multi-agent systems into a comprehensive, unbiased ranking framework for new drug target proposals.

Responsibilities


Provide agile software development services in line with the project plan
Offer technical consulting services to support the project team
Design and implement RESTful APIs
Utilize Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment processes using GitLab, GitOps, and Kubernetes for hosting services
Integrate selected open-source multi-agent systems towards a ranking framework for drug target proposals
(Optional) Assist with the implementation of user interfaces
(Optional) Work within high-performance computing environments


Required Qualifications


Educational background: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Approximately 5 years of professional experience in a similar role
Proficiency in Python with a solid understanding of software development principles and best practices
Deep knowledge and experience in designing and implementing RESTful APIs
Experience with CI/CD processes using GitLab, GitOps, and Kubernetes


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in machine learning engineering or MLOps, especially within the life sciences domain
Knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs) and LLM-based multi-agent frameworks from an engineering perspective (required for ML Engineer)
Experience working in HPC environments
Familiarity with implementing user interfaces


Would you like to learn more about CTC and the opportunity outlined? Please, get in contact with us: you may either use the 'apply now' button, or write an email to us, or reach out to vanessa.gilardoni@ctcresourcing.com
Show more

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir bauen ein multidisziplinäres Team auf, um unser Geschäft mit der Vernetzung und intelligenten Steuerung dezentraler Flexibilitäten auszubauen. Wir suchen einen Data Scientist, der mithilft die Entwicklung dieses Geschäftsbereichs voranzutreiben.




Pensum: 80-100%




Dein zukünftiger Alltag




Du erarbeitest Dir ein vertieftes Know-How in der Energiewirtschaft mit Fokus auf den Flexpooling Bereich, um die Hauptaufgaben der Stelle ausführen zu können
Du beschaffst und strukturierst Daten durch die Verknüpfung unterschiedlicher Datenquellen innerhalb und ausserhalb der CKW (v.a. via API)
Du entwickelst Tools und Algorithmen zur Analyse und Weiterverarbeitung der verschiedenen Daten, inkl. Modelle zur automatisierten Fehlererkennung, Datenbereinigung und Ersatzwertbildung
Du analysierst Daten, inkl. der Interpretation und visuellen Aufbereitung der Ergebnisse (u.a. in Power BI)
Du erstellst Prognosen, inkl. (Weiter-)Entwicklung der Prognosemodelle und teilst diese sowie die bereinigten Quelldaten, Deine Analysen und Prognosen mit Datenanwendern und weiteren Stakeholdern




Was du mitbringst




Abgeschlossenes Studium auf Stufe FH oder Uni im Bereich Naturwissenschaft oder Technik, idealerweise mit quantitativen Methoden sowie Datenbank- und Programmierkenntnisse als Studieninhalt
Hohe Datenaffinität und Begeisterung im Umgang mit Zahlen und Analysen sowie mit energiewirtschaftlichen Fragestellungen
Freude an der Entwicklung von neuen Themen und der Zusammenarbeit mit einem multidisziplinären Team
Methodisches Wissen und Praxiserfahrung in den Bereichen Data Science (Machine Learning), Big Data Technologien, Data Engineering & Modellierung, Datenvisualisierung, Zeitreihenanalyse, Statistische Analyse- und Prognoseverfahren, API-Anbindung, Agile Arbeitsmethoden (z.B. Scrum, Kanban) wünschenswert
Erfahrung in den Bereichen Energie(wirtschaft) und Flexpooling bzw. mit Energiemanagementsysteme wünschenswert
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse, weitere Sprachen sind ein Plus
Show more

  • Hohe Datenaffinität und Begeisterung im Umgang mit Zahlen und Analysen sowie mit energiewirtschaftlichen Fragestellungen
  • Freude an der Entwicklung von neuen Themen und der Zusammenarbeit mit einem multidisziplinären Team
  • Methodisches Wissen und Praxiserfahrung in den Bereichen Data Science (Machine Learning), Big Data Technologien, Data Engineering & Modellierung, Datenvisualisierung, Zeitreihenanalyse, Statistische Analyse- und Prognoseverfahren, API-Anbindung, Agile Arbeitsmethoden (z.B. Scrum, Kanban) wünschenswert
  • Erfahrung in den Bereichen Energie(wirtschaft) und Flexpooling bzw. mit Energiemanagementsysteme wünschenswert
  • Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse, weitere Sprachen sind ein Plus

Title: Data Scientist (80-100%)
Description:
Clarunis Universitäres Bauchzentrum Basel ist das gemeinsame Kompetenzzentrum des Claraspitals und des Universitätsspitals Basel für alle Patienten, die auf eine Behandlung im Bauchbereich angewiesen sind. Clarunis vereint das Fachwissen, die Forschungstätigkeit und die Zahl der behandelten Patienten beider Spitäler, um die Qualität der Diagnose und der Behandlung noch weiter zu steigern und zu verbessern.

Clarunis Universitäres Bauchzentrum Basel ist das gemeinsame Kompetenzzentrum des Claraspitals und desUniversitätsspitals Basel für alle Patienten, die auf eine Behandlung im Bauchbereich angewiesen sind.Clarunis vereint das Fachwissen, die Forschungstätigkeit und die Zahl der behandelten Patienten beiderSpitäler, um die Qualität der Diagnose und der Behandlung noch weiter zu steigern und zu verbessern.Das Forschungsgruppe Digital Surgery Lab (https://digitalsurgerylab.ch) am Department of BiomedicalEngineering der Universität Basel hat zum Ziel durch Digitalisierung und Künstliche Intelligenz die Chirurgiezu revolutionieren und die Behandlungsqualität für Patienten zu verbessern.Um das Projekt Data-Driven Surgery voranzubringen und den Aufbau einer Datenplattform (Surgical AIplatform) für das Departement Chirurgie des Universitätsspital Basel zu koordinieren, suchen wir nachVereinbarung eine/nData Scientist




Data Scientist (80-100%)




Ihre Aufgaben sind:

Transdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit mit Klinikern und Ingenieuren
Koordination der Entwicklung der Surgical AI platform mit externen Anbietern
Erstellen von Strukturen zum Erfassen, Aufbewahrung und Archivieren von Daten
Analyse medizinischer Datensätze (Bild, Video, Audio, Text) mittels deep learning




Sie bringen mit:

Doktorat in Computerwissenschaften oder Biomedical Engineering
Projektmanagement Fähigkeiten und Erfahrung
Ein starker Hintergrund in Netzwerkarchitektur und machine/deep learning
Kompetenz im Programmieren in Python und Erfahrung mit gängigen deep learning Bibliotheken (PyTorch, TensorFlow)




Wir bieten:

Eine anspruchsvolle Aufgabe in einem akademischen Umfeld
Zeitgemässe Anstellungsbedingungen
Grosszügige Sozialversicherungsleistungen
Möglichkeit zur akademischen oder unternehmerischen Weiterentwicklung
Mentoring




Fühlen Sie sich angesprochen und sind bereit, diese Herausforderung anzunehmen, dann freuen wir unsauf Ihre Online-Bewerbung an hr@clarunis.ch.




Weitere Auskünfte erteilt Ihnen gerne Dr. Joël Lavanchy, Forschungsgruppenleiter und Oberarzt(joel.lavanchy@clarunis.ch).

Show more

Title: AI Researcher (LLM) - (100% remote)
Description:
At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

The role involves building AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops.

Our dynamic team operates entirely remotely, uniting talent from every corner of the globe. Our journey has been marked by rapid growth and efficient operations, firmly establishing us as pioneers within the industry. Join us in building AI models and solutions that not only compete with but exceed the capabilities of current leaders, driving both technological advancement and broad accessibility.

What You'll Do:


Research and Development of multimodal AI models that set new industry standards.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure our AI models are effectively integrated into market-driven solutions.
A degree in Computer Science. Ideally PhD in NLP, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D(with good publications in A* conferences).
Experience building a LLM or other large models from scratch including writing model code, gathering training data, optimizing training and inference.
Strong experience in NLP, multimodal learning, proficient in TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
Excellent programming skills in Python.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer / Trader (H/F) 80-100%
Description:
Description du poste :

 

Actif·ve·s en Suisse occidentale, nous aidons nos client·e·s à réaliser leurs projets en fournissant des solutions énergétiques globales, efficaces et durables, qu’il s’agisse de production et de distribution d’électricité et de chaleur, d’installations électriques, de domotique, de mobilité douce, de climatisation ou de traitement de l’eau. Employeur exemplaire, nous soutenons le développement des compétences de nos 2700 collaborateurs·trice·s, dont 260 apprenti·e·s, ainsi que la conciliation entre vie privée et professionnelle.

La Direction Energie électrique exploite les infrastructures de production hydrauliques et thermiques, développe des installations de production à partir d’énergies renouvelables et assure un approvisionnement en électricité aux meilleures conditions. 

Afin de compléter notre équipe, nous sommes à la recherche de notre futur·e :

 

Machine Learning Engineer / Trader (H/F) 80-100%

 

Mission : 

Développer des algorithmes et modèles prédictifs s’intégrant dans l’activités de gestion de portefeuilles (times series, machine learning, data engineering, …) 
Optimiser financièrement, définir et réaliser des stratégies de couverture des portefeuilles de production et de consommation sur les marchés de l’électricité
Valoriser les ouvrages de production et saisir les opportunités avec toutes les options de valorisation de la flexibilité
Concevoir des outils d’étude statistiques et pouvoir présenter les résultats de manière efficace 

 

Profil :

Formation technique supérieure (EPF/HES/UNI), idéalement dans le domaine de la data science 
Expérience dans le « machine learning », idéalement dans les time series
Connaissance de l’écosystème Linux, Docker et GIT
Maîtrise d’un ou plusieurs langages de programmation, particulièrement pour Python (Pandas) et SQL
Compétences avancées en mathématiques, statistiques, probabilités et connaissances des systèmes stochastiques
Idéalement, connaissances du marché de l’énergie, des installations hydrauliques et des prévisions météorologiques.
Prêt à vous engager, orienté marché et négoce, résistant au stress (possibilité de travailler jusqu'à 20% en télétravail)
Service de piquet sur appel 24/24 depuis votre domicile (toutes les 6 semaines)

Ce que nous vous offrons : 

Un environnement évolutif et favorable à l’équilibre entre la vie professionnelle et privée.
Les prestations sociales d’une entreprise moderne, une équité de traitement, des possibilités de développement professionnel.
Un fort esprit de cohésion et une équipe fière de collaborer : « Ensemble, nous avançons vers la réussite ».

 

Besoin de renseignements complémentaires ?Contactez Alain Berset, Responsable Gestion court terme au 079 518 62 00.

 

Ressources Humaines

Brice Muller

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you looking for an R&D environment where you can work with world-class scientists and engineers on cutting edge projects? Do you want to contribute to a better world while building a career? Do you also have a passion for science, engineering, technology, business, data and human creativity?

You will be part of a diverse and inclusive team of Data Scientists and Engineers working on solving interesting, real-world problems that truly make a difference. Your main responsibilities will be to deliver value for clients in the Nordics. Supported by our global knowledge base and network of skilled colleagues, you will be part of strategic discussions and contribute to solutioning.

Requirements For The Role


Masters or PhD in a scientific field (computer science, mathematics, biology, engineering etc.)
A minimum of 5 years of relevant academic or professional experience within data engineering and data science
An analytical mindset, a willingness to roll up your sleeves and solve hands-on technical challenges
Excellent communication and presentation skills and an ability to explain complex concepts
Experience in one or several object-oriented scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
Knowledge of cloud platforms, tools and services provided by AWS, Azure or Google Cloud
Understanding how to implement effective ETL steps on said platforms
Excellent English communication skills, both verbally and written
Be an EU citizen or hold a work permit


Meritorious Skills


5+ years of professional experience
Business analysis and tech project management skills are an advantage
Working knowledge of databases, SQL and/or Elasticsearch, and experience with data management tools such as Databricks.
Experience implementing data pipelines using tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, Knime (or similar)


What We Offer

Capgemini Engineering is one of the world's leading consulting companies in R&D. We work in most industries globally. We deliver, together with our global centers of expertise, solutions for both large global customers and smaller local start-up companies.

We offer you a work environment branded by innovation. You will be working with the cutting edge of IT and technology, surrounded by dedicated and skilled colleagues with high expertise.

As a consultant at Capgemini Engineering, you will belong in a global professional community with well formed career paths, trainings and opportunities for mentorship and continuous competence development opportunities.

Join us and Get The Future You Want!

Welcome with your application!

Title: (Global Oil Gas) Senior Data Scientist
Description:
This role required candidate to permanently relocate at Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.

About the Company



This company engages in the exploration, production, transportation, and sale of crude oil and natural gas. It operates through the following segments: Upstream, Downstream, and Corporate. The Upstream segment includes crude oil, natural gas and natural gas liquids exploration, field development, and production. The Downstream segment focuses on refining, logistics, power generation, and the marketing of crude oil, petroleum and petrochemical products, and related services to international and domestic customers. The Corporate segment offers supporting services including human resources, finance, and information technology. The company was founded on May 29, 1933 and is headquartered in Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.

Job Summary

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join the Sales & Operations Planning Division's (S&OP) under the Global Optimizer Department. S&OP's primary responsibility is to optimize crude allocation and operations across global manufacturing facilities. This optimization aims to maximize revenue, increase profitability, and capitalize on international market opportunities.

The division serves as the gatekeeper for linear programming (LP) at wholly owned refineries and oversees the integrated global MPIMS model. This model is crucial for optimizing global crude allocation, exploring new international markets, and integrating operational options.

As a Data Scientist, your main role will involve analyzing and structuring large volumes of real-time and historical data. You will build algorithms and solutions around this data to facilitate decision-making within the company. Your work will be pivotal in supporting the company's forecasting and predictive digital strategy, contributing to the development of advanced solutions at the Downstream Digital Center.

Key Responsibilities:

Formulate and lead multifaceted analytic studies against large volumes of data.
Interpret and analyze data using exploratory mathematical and statistical techniques based on the scientific method.
Coordinate research and analytic activities utilizing various data points (unstructured and structured) and employ programming to clean, massage, and organize the data.
Experiment against data points, provide information based on experiment results, and offer previously undiscovered solutions to complex data challenges.
Lead all data experiments tasked by the Data Science Team.
Coordinate with Data Engineers to build data environments providing data identified by Data Analysts, Data Integrators, Knowledge Managers, and Intel Analysts.
Develop methodology and processes for prioritization and scheduling of projects.
Analyze problems and determine root causes.
Define company data assets (data models), Spark, SparkSQL, and HiveSQL jobs to populate data models.
Work closely with all business units and engineering teams to develop strategy for long-term data platform architecture.



Requirements:

Willingness to relocate to Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.
Hold a Bachelor's degree in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, or related fields. An advanced degree is preferred.
Have 5-7 years of professional experience in a related field.
Proficiency with one or more programming languages (Java, C++, Python, R, etc.).
Demonstrate experience applying data science methods to real-world data problems.
Experience in utilizing visualization tools to leverage the growing volume of available information.

Title: Postdoctoral Fellow (m/f/d) Cheminformatics Data Scientist – 2 years
Description:
Company Description

As a world market leader in crop protection, we help farmers to counter these threats and ensure enough safe, nutritious, affordable food for all – while minimizing the use of land and other agricultural inputs. Syngenta Crop Protection keeps plants safe from planting to harvesting. From the moment a seed is planted through to harvest, crops need to be protected from weeds, insects and diseases as well as droughts and floods, heat and cold. Syngenta Crop Protection is headquartered in Switzerland.

Job Description

We are currently seeking a 2-year fixed term Postdoctoral Fellowship contract in our chemistry department in Stein AG, Switzerland where you will be given the opportunity to develop new skills while working at the cutting edge of science and innovation. At Syngenta, our work matters; we are looking for the talents of today and tomorrow.

Responsibilities

We are seeking a dynamic individual to join our team and contribute to the enhancement of our High-Throughput Experimentation (HTE) platform through the implementation and integration in our software platform of cutting-edge experimental design algorithms. In this role, you will be responsible for:


Conducting a detailed analysis of existing methodologies for design of experiments, including design of experiments and Bayesian approaches, and providing a comprehensive summary of their features.
Developing a robust Python package that integrates all pertinent existing algorithms, ensuring seamless interaction with our internal reaction data management software platform.
Leveraging large-scale chemical reaction conditions datasets to create machine learning algorithms that enable intelligent selection of variables and their values as input to reaction optimization experimental design
Establishing the groundwork for customizable, on-demand machine learning models for reaction optimization that users can operate independently.
Crafting intuitive graphical user visualizations for straightforward interpretation of results by end-users.


As an integral part of our collaborative team, you will work closely with automation scientists and chemists who are the primary beneficiaries of your work, enhancing the platform through continuous iterative feedback.

You will find your place within a diverse team of Chemists and Computer Scientists, all of whom bring extensive knowledge in cheminformatics and software development.

Our organization is a fervent advocate for open-source software development and encourages the public sharing of our collaborative achievements.

Join us to advance your career and shape the future of experimental design in a stimulating and forward-thinking environment.

Qualifications


PhD in cheminformatics or machine learning
Demonstrated experience in chemical informatics, algorithms, and/or software design
Demonstrated working knowledge and application of statistics and data modeling to large scale life-sciences data.


What We Expect


Strong knowledge in chemical informatics, including methods to manipulate chemical structure information and representations (ideally using RDKit)
Mastering of chemical concepts (structure, reactivity, properties, some knowledge in experimental design is a plus)
Knowledge in programming (python)
Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques
Skills in data visualization and representation for analytics purposes is a plus
Fluency in spoken and written English language
Be an effective communicator, self-motivated, and able to drive insights into actions


Additional Information

What We Offer


Contribution to valuable and impactful work, in a stimulating environment -> #bringingplantpotentialtolife
Work in interdisciplinary teams
A superb working environment at our Global Research Center in Stein
Scientific and technical excellence
Scientific and technical support, including mentoring and tutoring
Continuous professional development and high scientific standards are foundations of our culture
State-of-the-art tools, access to professional infrastructure


Interested? We are looking for your online application. Please provide a Research Summary of 2-5 pages. Any applications submitted without a Research Summary will not be subject to further evaluation.

Please be aware that the job title may differ from the position title.

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. We favor work life balance and enable flexible working.
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

As a world market leader in crop protection, we help farmers to counter these threats and ensure enough safe, nutritious, affordable food for all – while minimizing the use of land and other agricultural inputs. Syngenta Crop Protection keeps plants safe from planting to harvesting. From the moment a seed is planted through to harvest, crops need to be protected from weeds, insects and diseases as well as droughts and floods, heat and cold. Syngenta Crop Protection is headquartered in Switzerland.

Job Description

We are currently seeking a 2-year fixed term Postdoctoral Fellowship contract in our chemistry department in Stein AG, Switzerland where you will be given the opportunity to develop new skills while working at the cutting edge of science and innovation. At Syngenta, our work matters; we are looking for the talents of today and tomorrow.

Responsibilities

We are seeking a dynamic individual to join our team and contribute to the enhancement of our High-Throughput Experimentation (HTE) platform through the implementation and integration in our software platform of cutting-edge experimental design algorithms. In this role, you will be responsible for:

  • Conducting a detailed analysis of existing methodologies for design of experiments, including design of experiments and Bayesian approaches, and providing a comprehensive summary of their features.
  • Developing a robust Python package that integrates all pertinent existing algorithms, ensuring seamless interaction with our internal reaction data management software platform.
  • Leveraging large-scale chemical reaction conditions datasets to create machine learning algorithms that enable intelligent selection of variables and their values as input to reaction optimization experimental design
  • Establishing the groundwork for customizable, on-demand machine learning models for reaction optimization that users can operate independently.
  • Crafting intuitive graphical user visualizations for straightforward interpretation of results by end-users.

As an integral part of our collaborative team, you will work closely with automation scientists and chemists who are the primary beneficiaries of your work, enhancing the platform through continuous iterative feedback.

You will find your place within a diverse team of Chemists and Computer Scientists, all of whom bring extensive knowledge in cheminformatics and software development.

Our organization is a fervent advocate for open-source software development and encourages the public sharing of our collaborative achievements.

Join us to advance your career and shape the future of experimental design in a stimulating and forward-thinking environment.

Qualifications

  • PhD in cheminformatics or machine learning
  • Demonstrated experience in chemical informatics, algorithms, and/or software design
  • Demonstrated working knowledge and application of statistics and data modeling to large scale life-sciences data.

What We Expect

  • Strong knowledge in chemical informatics, including methods to manipulate chemical structure information and representations (ideally using RDKit)
  • Mastering of chemical concepts (structure, reactivity, properties, some knowledge in experimental design is a plus)
  • Knowledge in programming (python)
  • Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques
  • Skills in data visualization and representation for analytics purposes is a plus
  • Fluency in spoken and written English language
  • Be an effective communicator, self-motivated, and able to drive insights into actions

Additional Information

What We Offer

  • Contribution to valuable and impactful work, in a stimulating environment -> #bringingplantpotentialtolife
  • Work in interdisciplinary teams
  • A superb working environment at our Global Research Center in Stein
  • Scientific and technical excellence
  • Scientific and technical support, including mentoring and tutoring
  • Continuous professional development and high scientific standards are foundations of our culture
  • State-of-the-art tools, access to professional infrastructure

Interested? We are looking for your online application. Please provide a Research Summary of 2-5 pages. Any applications submitted without a Research Summary will not be subject to further evaluation.

Please be aware that the job title may differ from the position title.

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. We favor work life balance and enable flexible working.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (w/m) 80-100%
Description:
Die NZZ gehört zu den grössten privaten Medienunternehmen der Schweiz. Sie konzentriert sich auf qualitativ hochstehende, unabhängige Publizistik und vertritt liberale Perspektiven. Mit ihren Produkten bietet sie ihren Leserinnen und Nutzern täglich Orientierung und Inspiration.




Das Data Science Team unterstützt die NZZ dabei, ein datengetriebener Journalismus zu betreiben. Als Analytics Center of Competence ist es unsere Aufgabe, jedem in unserem Unternehmen die notwendigen Werkzeuge und das Wissen zur Verfügung zu stellen, um bessere und fundiertere Entscheidungen zu treffen und so zur digitalen Transformation beizutragen. In enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Produktmanagement-, Marketing- und Redaktionsteams entwickeln wir smarte Datenprodukte, um interne und kundenorientierte Anwendungsfälle zu unterstützen. Wir sind ein hochmotiviertes und kompetentes Team von Datenexperten (Datenanalysten, Data Scientists, Data Engineers), die mit agilen Entwicklungsmethoden arbeiten und die Prinzipien einer Innovationskultur leben, indem wir neueste Ideen iterativ testen und weiterentwickeln.




Nun suchen wir eine engagierte und gewinnende Persönlichkeit, die uns bei diesem Vorhaben tatkräftig unterstützt als




Senior Data Scientist (w/m) 80-100%




Deine Aufgaben

Konzeption und Umsetzung neuer Datenprodukte auf Basis von ML- und NLP-Techniken (z.B. Content-Recommender-Systeme) unter Berücksichtigung von Risiken und Trade-offs
Verantwortung und kontinuierliche Optimierung von robusten Datenpipelines in der Cloud
Überwachung, A/B-Testing und Optimierung der Modelle in der Produktion
Enge Abstimmung mit den Bereichen Produkt, Marketing und Redaktion zur Weiterentwicklung unserer Datenprodukte
Durchführung von komplexeren Analysen einschliesslich Aufbereitung und Präsentation der Ergebnisse
Übernahme von Fach- und Ideenführerschaft in verschiedenen Data-Science-Themen
Ausschau halten nach interessanten Tools und Algorithmen, die der NZZ weiterhelfen könnten




Dein Profil

Master-Abschluss in einer quantitativen Disziplin (Informatik, Mathematik, Statistik, Physik usw.)
Idealerweise über 5 Jahre Erfahrung auf Senior-Level
Fundierte theoretische und praktische Kenntnisse in den Bereichen Statistik, maschinelles Lernen und Verarbeitung natürlicher Sprache
Praktische Erfahrung mit gängigen Data-Science-Tools und -Bibliotheken (z. B. scikit-learn, pandas, Keras)
Ausgeprägte Programmierkenntnisse (ein Muss: Python & SQL, ein Nice-to-have: Scala)
Praktische Erfahrung mit Cloud- und Big-Data-Frameworks (z. B. Apache Spark)
Leidenschaft für KI
Neugierige Denkweise, starke Arbeitsmoral und sehr ausgeprägte Fähigkeiten zur Zusammenarbeit
Sehr gute Englisch- und gute Deutschkenntnisse




Unser Angebot

Von uns kannst du ein vielfältiges, dynamisches und kreatives Arbeitsumfeld erwarten, in einem Team, das mit Leidenschaft bei der Sache ist und ein breites Spektrum an Fähigkeiten vereint
Uns ist wichtig, dass wir uns stetig verbessern und gemeinsam Ziele erreichen. Wie jedes Teammitglied hast du die Möglichkeit, sowohl auf unsere Arbeitsweise als auch auf unsere Arbeit Einfluss zu nehmen
Vielfältige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten (intern und extern)
Eine fantastische Arbeitsumgebung: unsere Büroräumlichkeiten sind zentral «am Bellevue» im Herzen von Zürich – mit Blick auf das Opernhaus und den See
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Homeoffice-Regelung sind Teil unserer Kultur




Dein Arbeitsort

Neue Zürcher Zeitung AG, Falkenstrasse 11, CH-8008 Zürich




Dein nächster Schritt

Bist du interessiert? Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung. Für Fragen kannst du die gerne an Lukas Görög, Team Lead AI & Data Science , Tel. +41 44 258 14 53, oder Michael Bletsch, Recruiter, Tel. +41 44 258 17 29 wenden.

Show more

Title: (Junior) Cloud Engineer (a) 60-100%
Description:
Suchst du viel Handlungsspielraum, ein wertschätzendes Umfeld, neue Technologien sowie eine fördernde Unternehmenskultur? Unsere Kundin, ein IT-Dienstleistungsunternehmen mit mehreren Standorten in der Deutschschweiz, sucht zur Verstärkung ihres Teams mehrere (Junior) Cloud Engineers (a). Das Unternehmen ist seit mehr als 25 Jahren einer der führenden Softwarehersteller von CRM-Software und hat heute über 300 Mitarbeitende.




Deine Herausforderung

In deiner neuen Rolle als Junior Cloud Engineer entwickelst du gemeinsam im Team die Multi-Cloud Betriebsplattform. Du stellst den Betrieb der Cloud-Plattform sicher, realisierst kundenspezifische Projekte und entwickelst die SaaS-Lösungen weiter. Dabei bringst du deine bisherigen Fachkenntnisse sowie Erfahrungen gekonnt ein und setzt dich aktiv mit neuen Technologien auseinander.




Deine Qualitäten und Begabungen

Abgeschlossenes Technisches Studium (FH, Uni oder ETH)
Erste Berührungspunkte mit Cloud-Technologien
Grundlagenkenntnisse oder starkes Interesse an: Bash, Python, Docker, Kubernetes, Softwareautomatisierung, Linux etc.
Du arbeitest gerne im Team und dein unternehmerisches Denken zeichnet dich aus
Deutsch ist deine Muttersprache und du hast sehr gute Englischkenntnisse




Spannende Projekte, vielfältige Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten, flache Hierarchien und flexible Arbeitszeiten erwarten dich! Bist du interessiert?

Dann freut sich Lorena Alessandri auf deine Bewerbungsunterlagen oder auf deinen Anruf.




Lorena Alessandri

Niederlassungsleiterin

Telefon: +41 41 417 10 00

lorena.alessandri@consultandpepper.com

Title: Software Engineer III, AI/ML
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, or 1 year of experience with an advanced degree.
2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms.
Experience in coding and Machine Learning (ML).
Experience in Computer Vision.


Preferred qualifications:


Experience with software development in C++.


About The Job

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

Responsibilities


Write product or system development code.
Improve the signals and understand the query of Google Lens.
Develop and evaluate image embedding of lens quality.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Test Engineer / Software Tester
Description:
Test Engineer / Software Tester

Experis ist ein weltweit führender Anbieter von personalisierten Rekrutierungslösungen und Fachkräften im IT-Bereich.

Wir suchen dich! Einen erfahrenen Test Engineer zur Verstärkung des Teams unseres Kunden.

Start: 01.09.2024 oder nach Vereinbarung

Vertragsart: 12 Monate (mit Option auf Verlängerung)

Ort: Bern

Arbeitsmodel: Hybrid (Homeoffice nach Vereinbarung)

Pensum: 80% - 100% bei 40 Stunden pro Woche

Sprache: Deutsch C2, Englisch C1

Als Teil unseres Teams übernehmen Sie Verantwortung für die Durchführung und Dokumentation von Tests gemäß festgelegten Richtlinien und Standards.

Deine Aufgaben

Überprüfen der Testbarkeit von Benutzersystemen und Bewertungen
Validierung von Testkonzepten und -modellen
Analyse von Produkt-Risiken und Testumgebungen
Implementierung und Überwachung von Teststrategien und -werkzeugen
Ausführung, Überprüfung und Dokumentation von Testfällen
Fehleranalyse und -behebung sowie Leistungsüberprüfung von Testsystemen

Damit kannst du Punkten

Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Informatik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Testmethoden, -werkzeugen und -prozessen
Erfahrung in der Durchführung und Dokumentation von Tests
Teamfähigkeit, Kommunikationsstärke und selbstständige Arbeitsweise
Idealerweise Erfahrung mit Testautomatisierung und agilen Methoden

Aufgrund der Beschränkungen der Schweizer Arbeitsbewilligung können wir nur Bewerbungen von Schweizer Staatsangehörigen, EU-Bürgern oder Inhabern einer aktuellen Arbeitsbewilligung für die Schweiz berücksichtigen.

Unser Kunde bietet dir die Möglichkeit, in einem spannenden und zukunftsorientierten Umfeld zu arbeiten und deine Fähigkeiten kontinuierlich weiterzuentwickeln. Wenn du dich angesprochen fühlst und die erforderlichen Qualifikationen mitbringst, freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung.

Tel.: +41 44 229 99 17
